IEEPuyL68EFskNh7flID7Q.text: Vibe was very cool. Sides were great. Burger was very dry and overcooked. Service was mediocre.

iVU2nZJyG7IRzVHKJPPpLQ.text: Let's start from the top. Great atmosphere, great service staff. The Mac & Cheese is to do for, if you don't get it you'll miss out!  We had a burger which went over well with the crowd. The ribeye, overpriced, but a ribeye; was cooked perfectly to a Med rare, had little to no flavor. I added salt and pepper and it was better.  All in all,  happy hour was great with Mac & Cheese, a burger and $3 beers. But don't kid yourself and expect a high quality steak..

NZVj7wZeBvFy382i6dBlwQ.text: My kids took me there for my belated Father's Day dinner. I ordered a mushroom burger and my kids ordered I think the California burger. One of the best burgers I've ever had. My kids said the same thing. The prices are great and the food is even better. I would definitely recommend this place. I will be going back to try other items on the menu. I didn't want to break my kids Wallet, they are still in high school. But they were as happy as I was with the food and prices.

42V9Bu6JnsPD3gkMTU8M8Q.text: Naomi was our server tonight and she helped swiftly guide us through the menu. I got the chopped salad and chicken melt and it was amazing. Great venue, fun hipster vibes, awesome drink list! Thanks Naomi :)

x0e0TJPEcr-Sj-CGUQgH9w.text: So we walk in and I love the vibe of this joint! Nice decor, there's a Dj, there's good HH deals I feel like we've found a great spot. The menu is your average steakhouse menu with good cuts of meat and family style sides. I check in on Facebook and I see a review that says "you have to get the chopped salad. I'm watching my calories trying to get ready for pool season so I go for it and add salmon. The salad arrives 35 minutes later and it's not a chopped salad at all in fact my friend says " it's a chop salad you have to chop yourself" it's a freakin DIY chopped salad! What ruined it for me was it was filled with arugula...can I just pause and talk about how arugula is literally the weed of lettuces?! Who eats arugula? Stop putting the foot weed of lettuces in peoples food. So anyway there's basically 3 bites of salmon and a pound of arugula that's has leaves big enough for me to drape myself in and 3 blueberries and this does not a chop salad make. #Fail I'll probably come back but just for HH drinks the food sucks

jr0hc2FDNQKJsmEKo4XzvQ.text: HD ribeye with mushrooms, awesome!!!! Side of truffle mashed potatoes....out of control.

9SO3pHbC6AfpKYZtKMs7HA.text: Excellent service!  Sophia (our server) was very helpful in selecting the right sweet beer for my "non-drinking" date.  We tried the chopped salad with slices of super tender steak and the delicious mushroom burger -- both bursting with flavor.  Without much ado, dishes were served to us already split -- nice touch. Thanks to the attentive hostess on Friday night we have good selfies to remember this place by.   MUST TRY, whether Happy Hour or not!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. upbeat surroundings with equally upbeat service and good food!

MPnwc49SYcn_mbvr6HbjQg.text: Trendy burger place. A little on the pricy side because it's located in downtown Scottsdale. Cocktail drink was more than mg meal @ $13. The zucchini fries were very tasty though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peach martini
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Onion rings, way too salty
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Random cow head decor

v4a8bMfvyfKJNO1cBp5SIw.text: I do not eat meat so I can't be of help in the burger department, but the burgers do look scrumptious. My boyfriend who has tried every burger in America said its his favorite burger. I love their unique cocktail menu and atmosphere is really cool, sleek and modern. I am a huge whiskey fan and they have a nice display of them. The service is good and quick, even with busy old town Scottsdale crowds. They did mess up my order but was quick to give me a free meal at my next visit. They have really good veggies and sides. Def recommend if you are in the area... but NOT kid friendly and super loud inside.

hr_gOla1ltvlE0GO8uuyzg.text: Ordered 2 of their steak salads through Postmates cause the way it was presented online sounded amazing. Arugula, avocados  and steak mmmm.   Got the salads. All Romain Lettuce. No avocado. And two small pieces (slices) of steak.   Definitely not worth 16$  Burgers may be good. But salads are not worth the cost.

apKgaEyuDLcdRQnGosHKNA.text: Was not sure what to expect. It's an eclectic feel, but overall nice appearance, although the layout of tables in the front is a bit cluttered and confined. Service was prompt and very nice overall. When trying somewhere new, the food is what makes or breaks a visit, not the decor or even service. Our table ordered 4 entrees and only one person was satisfied and appeased by their meal. I can only personally speak for my dishes, the lobster mac and cheese was not anything to rave or crave; it was noodles with a subpar bechamel. Did I mention it was lobster mac and cheese? Well there was not a piece of lobster to be found, but it did have an overly powering essence of seafood, that reminded me of a mothers tuna casserole. I ordered the 18oz bone in NY strip, it was a decent steak but again nothing Overly special; for myself nothing was overly satisfying, and this will more then likely be my first and last visit.

gU1TFYvTPE4cZVTDrkPzAw.text: Anytime my wife and I go somewhere I always give the establishment 3 chances before having negative inclinations. I will not be returning to hand cut for a long time unless something changes. I have noticed over the visits the burgers have gotten drastically smaller, the old fashioned has a mid level bourbon that is priced cheaper on the back of the menu rather than in the drink on the front of the menu. Yet when you order the same drink with a different bourbon it is priced to the alcohol. the service is sub par. After being sat on my most recent my wife had asked for a high chair for our daughter it took 3 requests to get one when there was a maximum of 8 covers in the restaurant... i guess you could consider that "busy" for the service staff there? Because that is what it seemed like... there was a hair in my drink and instead of taking care of the drink, an appetizer was taken off the bill which is at least an effort, but I guess it's cheaper to drive up food cost when alcohol is always marked up more than the food. And my burger was undercooked I asked for a medium and it came out rare-medrare. The center of our desert was cold. And the ice cream had crystals in it from refreezing. Overall I will not be recommending it to friends.

Qya77-niIyEbbSqKHYfY2w.text: We were excited to try this place but unfortunately it was not meant to be. The staff failed to acknowledge our existence even after we asked the hostess to send a server to our table. We won't be back.

abr5Hp3DwB9MsYl_9jL_iA.text: First I want to say that I try not to be negative when it comes to reviews but after having a thoroughly terrible experience here I wanted to let people know. It was a friends birthday last night, first time I've ever been there. Service was terrible (won't mention name), she took forever for everything, I had to stop her before she left for her to take my order. When she brought my food to the table she said she be back soon to check on me and to make sure the temperature was good. She never came back!! My steak was definitely not medium, only the middle was medium well at best and the rest of the steak was well done! I got the ribeye and it was almost as chewy as a sirloin! Thank god the Steaks were half off since it was Tuesday, couldn't justify paying for the meal otherwise... they charge almost as much if not the same as mastros or Ruth's Chris!! Wanted to talk to a manager but being my friends birthday and already only paying half off I really didn't want to make a big deal about it. The burgers on the other hand looked awesome and were reasonably priced. My cocktail was crafty but at $13 (more then the burgers) slightly ridiculous. If I were ever to come back, which I probably won't, I would go strictly to try the grass fed burgers! Don't try the steaks! If I ever payed 34 dollars for that steak I'd punch myself!

q9YdfqerL5qBq8kVFwN4sg.text: I was so excited to try this place. I only eat grass fed meat & was happy that there was a place in Scottsdale that served just that. I asked another couple to join us & reservations were made for Saturday evening at 6:30pm. The best thing about the place was we got right in at our reservation time. The decor is really well done, televisions for watching college football which was perfect for the guys. The great experience stopped there. We ordered drinks from the specialty drink menu, they were served in glasses that looked like they were child sized. For $12 I could take 3 sips and finish the drink, total rip off! We all ordered burgers and when they arrived, all four were not cooked as ordered. Two of us ordered well done and the burgers arrived medium/rare, the other two arrived rare and were ordered medium. My husband sent his back & we all ate what was served (didn't want to wait) a half hour later no burger ever arrived for my husband. At that point, he just said forget it & ate some of the side dishes, which were also very small servings & just ok tasting. The classic burger which I ordered did not even come with a tomato, I had to ask for it to be added & was charged! I realize they just opened a month ago & usually give a new restaurant 6 months before going, but thought how hard can it be to cook a burger they way you ask?? If they can't get that simple task accomplished, then they don't have a prayer. They will do well because of the location, but as a local, I will stick with Zinburger!!

JLy_ozIxWrJs0K8klCfbwA.text: This is fine dining done well. Half off cuts on Tuesdays, half off bottles of wine as well. The ambiance is casual for the quality of food,  which works for people who zigzagging just came for a burger and onion rings. Did two of my friends order steaks medium rare and get them medium... yes. Did they fix it when asked, yes. So customer service was a plus. The truffle mashed potatoes deserve attention, but if you come only once the venison is the dish of choice. The bar has room for those who want a beer and time to watch a game. This restaurant maybe just doesn't quite know what it is, but everything it does is done well.   If you give it a chance it will be worth your time. Check it out then decide.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Truffle mashed potatoes.
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Venison on the bone.

TrGiB9tZFMse_sA6LifT-w.text: I came here with a big group (18 girls) and it was nothing short of perfect for dinner.  The prices and portion sizes were appropriate and the wait staff was great at making sure everyone's preferences were met!  The steaks were cooked perfectly.  The ambiance was very trendy!  My only personal comment would be that the portions of the "sides to share" could be a little bigger.  The waitress recommended each to feed 2-3 people but I would say 1-2 would be safer if you are splitting between a group.

5hmu2t8Qy1EVr0TUmZDumw.text: Super delicious food and awesome service. The decor just puts it over the top into total awesomeness. Get the short rib dip and salt and vinegar fries you won't be disappointed.

nEprh_2QGLE5zRp3DE0cRw.text: What can I say about this place.... WOW!  This lovely cute and very hipster restaurant is all and more. I went here for the 1st time in Scottsdale. We loved the food. We order the venison, surf and turf, salt and vinegar fries, kale cesar salad and drinks... OMG! we couldnt be more satisfied than anything. The venison and surf and turf was perfectly cooked and tender. The kale salad, one of the best cesar salad in my life Drinks were lovely as well. Totally recommended. Nice place for dinner for sure.

rChuxthoP8Dsbc0gakq86A.text: Great looking crowd, and good vibes. Food did its job! Shoutout to the chips which was dusted in dill to perfection! What a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Western Bacon Burger &amp; Salt n Vinegar Chips

JLgmC6heNNgjz60JiZ5iAA.text: I passed by this restaurant on my many torturous trips to the mall. I finally got the opportunity to dine here and the my high expectations were not met. I was under the impression this was going to be a high end steakhouse; not the case. The women staff although very attractive give this a establishment a Hooters meets Texas Roadhouse. I had the Kale Caesar salad which was probably the worst dish of the night. It lacked flavor and something else to make it satisfying. The vinegar fries were surprisingly very tasty. They were full of flavor and tasted like fried chicken crust if that makes sense. The sides I had were the Mac N' Cheese and truffle mashed potatoes. Mac N' Cheese was the business. They were extremely cheesy and flavorful. Mashed potatoes had too much butter for my taste. The main entree was the 8 OZ filet. The steak was perfectly balanced and savory; similar to those at legit high end steakhouses. The food was pretty decent but the identity crisis and clothing attire gave it more of a sports bar kinda of feel instead of a steakhouse. Would I return....possibly not.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French fries
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 8 oz. filet

zzz3Nl_yjB63arwRj3xnUw.text: Oh man, this is a tough one... I so badly wanted to love this place!! But at the end of the day, my honest review is three stars with room for improvement.   So the positives: great, inviting decor! It's visual candy from the lighting to the flooring and overall style. It's such a fun vibe!! The cocktail I had was DEVINE!!!! I can't remember the name, something fruit with banana foam?! Delicious!! And the menu selection had everything you would expect for an upscale burger joint (fries and Mac n cheese, etc.).  The service was good and fast. Although our waitress was suggesting too many things... she kept trying to push a menu item, I can't recall which one, but we just didn't want it.  Oh, and when we first got there we ended up having to wait around 15+ mins to get seated, it was busy, but once we got back to the dining area, it wasn't packed and there were a lot of open tables. Just weird to wait so a while, when there was immediately available seating.  My main negative comment was the food was just so very bland. Like... everything we tried needed salt added to it. Maybe it was just an off night... but it was a total let down. You just kinda expect the tastes to match the visuals.   Once we added salt to our burgers and apps, everything tasted better.   I don't know if I'd ever go back specifically for the food...  but I'd def bring some gal pals out to try the drinks. Still a fun experience. Just hope the food is seasoned better next time.

6HBGl1gpNhmzJZAhDZLkrA.text: Recommended by staff at the resort we stayed at. Nice place, not so pleasant experience for our last night in town.  Our waitress pleasantly greeted us, gave us our waters and and we didn't see her again until after we had already ordered.  She took so long to come back and take our order, I looked lost looking around for her, another nice lady helped us.  It wasn't even busy.   Food took a long time to come out for a place that was practically empty.  Smoked salmon wasn't what we expected, sweet potato fries tasted funny.  We literally ate just our rib eye ALONE!  Baked potato and garlic fries came late and as I was STILL EATING the waitress came by and picked my plate up not once, but TWICE!!  As if we were being rushed out of there.  I was focused on having a good night with my boyfriend without the drama, I usually would call it quits as she touched my plate with her hands and I was still eating.  They weren't even getting ready to close.  This is the worst experience I've ever had.  Still paid $87 for a horrible experience and basically 2 rib eyes.  One which I didn't even get to finish bc the waitress touched my plate.  Actually I didn't even finish my food as I felt disgusted and rushed.

KdS8xYJ7FuVbkSr9CqOCiw.text: Seated promptly! I was so ready to have a drink & a nice meal so thank you for no wait time.  Parking is okay just grab a spot inside one of the parking garages, otherwise you may go around a few times on the street. Decor is industrial farmhouse which I love!!  Okay, now for our meals...  I ordered the classic burger medium rare, but I thought was a little over cooked. It was still good though. I checked in with Yelp so I received complimentary vinegar fries, and omg they are so good! We also ordered a side of mac and cheese it was excellent! I also had a bite of the salted caramel butter cake & it's bomb!! Served in a cute little casserole dish with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. So good!!  Oh I also had a cocktail which I loved it was a fig fashioned. They serve it with a ice sphere perfect to cool you off in this weather   Our server was amazing! She made sure our drinks were always filled. Super sweet!  It was my first time in I'm not sure why no one had told me about this place before.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Took a bite of this so scrumptious, lol BUT seriously!
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fig fashioned drink is so good
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vinegar fries

IRd48fkN2opVoaIjxONfQA.text: This place was a real pleasant surprise.  We were given a gift card, or we would have likely skipped by it forever.  The service was awesome.  Our server was super friendly, attentive and spaced out the meal perfectly.  The food was really good, sort of elevated bar food.  We only had burgers so we can't comment on the steaks.  Nice cocktails too.    The only thing holding them back from 5 stars is that it was super loud in there (they had a DJ) and as we were leaving the "scene" was getting a little douchey.  They have a great menu, well-trained staff and good food; I just wish they'd tone it down a little.  Still a great spot and could be a nice place to start a fun night out.

qkk8WBED_4iNo5M8lmkQaw.text: Service was good and the atmosphere is fun.   Dined here tonight. It's been a while since our first visit. Both of us ordered hamburgers. We weren't impressed by the quality of the beef, or the cook. His was medium (ordered medium rare) and both didn't have the grill we expected. It was clear the patties were cooked on a flat top and then domed cooked (the edges were gray), not grilled to achieve a good char, yummy crust and juicy moistness. The beef itself lacked that beefy flavor I expect from a quality burger.   The onion rings were on point and the fries good (though they could have been cooked a little more to achieve a more golden, crispy exterior).

5-dgNHRnp45XncplC7qxIQ.text: I'll start with the easy part...the food was outstanding!  The pork chop was cooked throughly which I must say was at first a bit of a concern when I was asked what temperature I preferred.  Maybe it's just me, but when it comes to a chop I better not see any pink inside.  It turned out delicious.   The first order of salt and vinegar fries were room temperature but they were promptly replaced with a delicious fresh basket that we quickly consumed so yummy!   Not a concern to me at all I just like piping hot fries.  (Did I say the fries were terrific? Yes!)  The Fig old fashion cocktail was creative with the presentation having the fig infused into the slowly melting ice ball! I need to try this at home!   My only "ding" is with server who brought our food.  It was not our original server (Madison was very engaging and great!).  We didn't have silverware and after the plates were set down by the other person, I asked for some.  They left us and rather than proceed to quickly retrieve the utensils, they were at a computer doing something else.  I had to walk over and another!   Now it might seem like a small detail to some,  but the vibe and ambiance of a place can hinge on the attention to the details.  Like the fig in the ice ball!  A fun way to engage guests in conversation and it adds to overall "wow" factor.  Having to seek out silverware while your food goes briefly untouched is a disappointment.    That same person then brought our second drinks and didn't mumble a word about anything.  A "enjoy" or "here you go" or "can I get anything else now?" Would have been polite. Probably upset that i said something, but I think with so much great food in the area, service can be the difference and management needs to know.  I'm looking forward to more great things to eat, more fun drinks to try, and maybe...just maybe...a little bit more attention to customer requests.  But again, 5 stars to Madison our delightful server for her attention to our details! And food we had was very delicious.  Made a return visit on Saturday 3/9 and the food was once again terrific.  I had the ribeye which was flavorful and cooked to perfection.  Our waitresses was extremely attentive to our every need.  They had a DJ playing tunes which created a nice vibe.  I recommend this to anyone looking for a fun evening in the Scottsdale Waterfront area.

-GYrE9diZd9NaCWi01VSeA.text: We had TERRIBLE service at this very chic, fun restaurant. Location great, beef filets: fabulous. Our waitress started out strongly, but soon forgot us. Had to retrieve our own silverware from the kitchen after asking several times. Received our sides several minutes after our entree. The brussels sprouts were hard and cold, the baked potato never came until after dinner. We asked for the manager several times: completely ignored our request. After he approached our table: many excuses why our food came out late, came out cold, not enough servers, etc. etc etc. He was apologetic but not accommodating. Finally, he did return with several discounts on our meal and apologies. Sadly, our experience was very negative.

J40h2ZtgKvoPuGDmT0ivDA.text: This place had a cool vibe and seemed great for birthday parties for mid-sized groups of people.  There were a couple celebrations going on when my friends and I went for dinner.  That said, I wasn't super impressed with what I ordered, and wished I had ordered something else.  I got the Crispy Chicken sandwich, and specifically wasn't a huge fan of the fried tempura.  I was hoping there would be some sort of light and crunchy breading instead of fried batter.  It kind of weighed down the sandwich.  Also, the sandwich tasted fine, but the chicken was a bit dry.  If I go back to Hand Cut, I'd order a burger or a steak next time.  I did try the Salt & Vinegar fries though, and really enjoyed those!  They came with ranch dressing on the side, and that complimented the fries nicely.

g-0QlUE1098GBoEhmkhRDw.text: Thought this place would be good with the number of 4 stars but not worth the stars. I gave it 2 , our waitress was good but the food was over priced and not good. We waited 45 min for our food. The chicken sandwich was all breaded no chicken at all.  Bad.. bad!! Never once did a manger come over to see how were doing or apologized about the wait.  Won't be back

6uS3ncc6vZRsWabdupGkwA.text: I stopped in here after shopping at Nordstrom's since it's across the street. It was happy hour so I had a wine and a burger. It was decent. They weren't busy which was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie burger

XJIOTLIiRRkdQl1QJw4G-w.text: My friend and I stumbled upon this place and went for dinner after seeing the great reviews. Plus they offer free salt and vinegar fries with a yelp check-in. Yaaas! Salt and vinegar chips are my favorite, they may make my mouth feel like sand paper but they are so addicting I can't get enough! But I digress..   The night we came here, it was busy so obviously we had to wait. We couldn't even sit at the bar so we had to stand awkwardly in the way. The drinks were tasty. There was a lot to choose from and the combinations in the cocktail were pretty genius. Pricey for the amount you got, but it's a trendy Scottsdale restaurant.   We waited FOR.EVER. Which is why one star is knocked off. There were several staff just hanging out and chatting while one person was cleaning and turning over tables. I was so hungry I wanted to clean a table myself so we could be seated.  On to the food. The salt and vinegar fries were everything I dreamed they would be. Perfection! We also got the bacon mac and cheese and the creamed corn. First of all, bacon mac and cheese is LIFE but it could've been more cheesy and the breadcrumbs were a little too crispy, almost stale. And there wasn't enough bacon. The creamed corn was probably my favorite thing we got. I'm not the biggest fan of corn but I wanted to take a bath in this dish it was so amazing. Marry it and have its babies. If you ever come here, ORDER IT. We also shared the 8oz filet. I wanted it cooked medium rare and my friend wanted medium so they actually cut it in half and we got our own mini which was nice. We added on the garlic butter mushrooms but they put them in a dish on the side which was weird. Like I wanted them added onto the steak, which I thought was implied with the term "add-on". But whatever.   All in all, the food was fabulous. The service was not. We waited so long for everything. It seemed like we had a few servers not just one. Maybe her section was overly busy? I didn't get a drink I ordered and she didn't even apologize just said, "oh I forgot to put it in" and walked away. I would recommend this place and come back again in a heartbeat if it wasn't for the service. That would be my only hesitation because I get HANGRY. So you should definitely go to this place, just not when you're starving. And be prepared to wait.

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon mac and cheese. Needs more cheese and more bacon
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salt and vinegar fries  I could eat them all day

g4uIeraMmuOAFsMiU_hpuA.text: Wow!! This place is amazing  Hands down the best place on the block!! The atmosphere and layout of this restaurant is amazing, the foods even better and I'm a picky eater lol. The airline chicken is the best thing on the menu in my opinion paired perfecting with bacon Mac n cheese and the Parmesan Brussel sprouts!!   I'm not much of a drinker but looking at the bar it seemed like they had a bunch of creative, fun looking alcohol options too!! Easily 5/5

4qHUM_9Ur4zlP9vFpYW8pw.text: This s*** is bananas martini is the bomb.com!!! Full review pending actually having dinner here but couldn't resist sharing this adorable cocktail win.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana cocktail

AAADhP7y6YtDjQQoep9Ouw.text: This is a great place with food you will love!!!  The staff are amazing and I have to give, Maddy the bartender credit for doing a great job and representing the restuaut with True professionalism.

P6EpWiOIGDYrqwhAylPhcw.text: Incredible place in a great location.  Staff is super knowledgeable without being stuck up.  Food was off the charts - Venison loin chops medium rare we're unreal, and the butter cake was as good as Maestros.  Price?  Here it goes - Tuesday is half off bottle of wine and all Cuts (seafood and chicken too).  We had: a bottle of very nice Cab, artichoke dip app which was incredible and different, a chopped salad (fresh and amazing), venison loin chops (yep, you read it right), sauteed mushrooms and the butter cake.  Walked out stuffed for a total of $71!  You cannot get this food, wine and service for that price anywhere.

yEcmbbrG9assGq9YRmEKPA.text: Good news, Hand Cut has created a unique, fun vibe to enjoy cocktails and some hand food. Unfortunately wasn't the right vibe for an adult family dinner. We had made reservations for dinner which when arrived, had a table that was super low to the ground and was set up to enjoy cocktails and chit chat, not totally suitable for dinner. It was also set up next to a birthday party was gathering which my brother in law kept getting  hit in the face by purses and butts, awkward. And we didn't want to be rude either to interrupt the festivities.   My dad had ordered the venison - which he was super excited about - and when came out was cold unfortunately twice. My mom ordered a veggie burger that was crumbling by each attempt to bite. Will say their mushroom burger and pulled pork was delicious and on point.   Their service was really great and cocktails were amazing!

ryhRNh20334JX4PVSPaCgw.text: I came here with my boyfriend opening day and I was seriously impressed with the interior. When they first opened you had to order before you sat down and then find a table. That wasn't logical for that place hence why they changed it and made it way better. Now you sit down and order. I love the burgers there. They're so light and delicious. They have added a lot more items on the menu which I was really thrilled about. I got the California burger and fries. DELICIOUS. It just melt in your mouth. There desserts there are amazing too. You must go if you haven't. You won't be let down!

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salt and vinegar fries. Top is cheddar burger with an egg. Bottom is california burger

croYwQhVU7T3-OOxfovOPA.text: I ordered the Bone in NY steak and it was cooked perfectly for me. The house sauce they had on top of it was amazing as well. Servers were super courteous and friendly. The ambience was pretty cool, it could be romantic and it could be chill, depends where u sit I guess. But overall, I had a great time and very satisfied.

sPJxLL9-mxIsI_yOIyCujQ.text: Very eclectic vibe, with a variety of burgers and chops, as well as craft cocktails. I'd like to come back and try a few more items, I had the Venison Rib Chops as my entree and it was very good, but their app selection isn't as great as it could be. We went opening night, and service was a little slow, we sort of expected such. Their burger selection however, is where I'm most interested.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Venison Rib Chop, excellent plating

zpuH1mEOeLJ4l5LK12AZBg.text: Great food - had the Venison one night, and the flatiron steak the other night, both cooked perfectly.  Prices are not astronomical, given the location and style of the place.  But oh my God - the music is atrocious! Why does a restaurant need a DJ?  Disco music is not what I want to dine to ... repetitive beat, constant thumping, no recognizable music, and LOUD - I had a hard time hearing my partner at the bar. Isn't that what nightclubs are for - go listen to deafening music and give up all hope of conversation?

bxhu7CkuDVNyQO00dt1Q8Q.text: So disappointed in this place. Started out good - the appetizers were yummy, but did take forever to come out. Then the wait was over 45 min for two burgers. Our side order of fries came before the burgers and were very overdone. The burgers were ok. There was so much oil on the buns I couldn't even eat it. There seems to be a million people working here and no one could refill my water without me asking. It seemed like the staff was way more interested in flirting with each other than actually doing their jobs. Our waitress did take off the appetizers, which was nice, but we will definitely not be back.

SpgkJ_o9-u7pDos--kFCMg.text: Checked out this new spot on a recent Friday night. They have the text message wait system, but it was just a short 20 minute wait around 8pm. We got lucky and had some prime outdoor seats (The green chairs look padded, but are clearly not). Ashley was quite a nice waitress and we proceeded to cash in on my free app.coupon with the $10 new Spinach dip. A more upscale version served with toast points and the dip itself shined with a garlicky taste and a big surprise of raisins...yep secret ingredient perhaps?     Our burgers ($9 and $11) were cooked well, mine was actually crisp on the edges. Just had the classic, but the bun was squishy soft and it reminded me of an upscale Big Mac with the sauce they use. Not a fried egg fan, but the mushroom cheddar burger with egg got good reviews. Also, they have half orders of onion rings at $3 (not on the menu), but those panko crusted rings are worth an order. Good addition to the area.

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The classic
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg on

-a_ia6hhxanRp7aVAxOv6A.text: Okay. Hands down, best. Burger. Ever. That is a pretty bold statement from me considering my grandparents own a beef ranch and I've never had a restaurant or "store bought" patty come within a fraction of the ones we make at home. I had the blue cheese burger. Wow!! The most juicy, flavorful patty (slightly misshapen you could tell it had just been ground and gently formed into patty shape and not over handled). Great choice on buns because they are good but not really noticed since it's what's inside that is the star (not too bready, not dry, just good). The toppings omg mmm. Perfectly cooked. I need another now!   My only regret was ordering the sides. The mac and cheese is rather plain and the sauce kind of thick/goopy and bland. Brussels and sweet potato, again very plain. Neither were bad though we ate it all. The salt and vinegar fries could rally be spectacular if they quadrupled the amount of salt vinegar seasoning! I wish they had a shake menu.   Next time going for just the burger. Would have been 4stars but the burger is so over the top good I have to give them all 5!

-IFVMK7p8sSRUA5ar2BZ4w.text: Went in for lunch today and while all other restaurants nearby were packed, this place had only a few people dining. Our server started out by telling us everything she likes on the menu and when asked if they could make a simple alteration to dish for allergy reasons, she was quite put off.  Ordered a side salad because it said it was only baby greens and vinaigrette but then came with corn, blueberries and cucumbers, two of which I am very allergic to. It's so important to include all ingredients so people aren't served something they aren't aware of and allergic to. My husband had a bib lettuce wrap the lettuce was dirty still. We won't be back and I think the others around us felt the same way. It's too bad because Phoenix has a lot of stiff competition and it's not easy competing with the other fantastic spots in the area. They have a good concept, but are missing the mark.

WgLlipUYHwWSJzd5ZgWWcQ.text: Was brought by friends to this restaurant on a weekend. Location wasn't too full and was quickly able to get a table without reservations. Ordered the tempura zucchini- would have preferred the strips to be thinner so could have had a better texture. Western and California burgers were good but nothing special to return to.

BIMWxeBb_ekXAS9v8EV7IQ.text: I had a phenomenal experience at Hand Cut. Everything from the atmosphere, to the bartender (Nate, I believe), to the food, to the drinks were amazing. We came in to get a table, but since it was full we sat at the bar. Nate was very knowledgeable on the menu and was suggestive as well. He suggested appetizers, went through the seasonal items, and answered any questions we had.  I ordered the Gardener, which is a cocktail made with Basil Hayden, berry preserves, and crushed ice. The cocktail was executed extremely well with a good balance of the bourbon with sweetness yet remained very light.   The two of us shared the pork and the salmon, with a side of the asparagus... both AMAZING and wished we could order it all over again.   I would recommend Hand Cut to everyone with the experience I had last night!

dd7hjj9K_PNw9fUaGlyRMA.text: Excellent and suburb food, drink and service. Ashley is terrific and very pleasant, professional and always smiling. Without a doubt the hit of our visit to this new culinary adventure in Scottsdale, AZ PS Haylee is learning from the best and will be Awesome!!!

tMV0UTxu2vwlp-2hHnDZdw.text: My boyfriend and I had been wanting to try this place ever since it opened. It looked amazing (from the outside). Needless to say we were beyond disappointed. We were seated at a table that had the booth covered in crumbs and food and the table was the same with multiple areas of sticky mess. Ordered my burger medium well. Waited 45 minutes for the food. It was medium rare. The mac N cheese was plain and tasted like it was out of a box. Fries... meh... eatable but not notorious. There was some kind of particle chunk poured into my water. Just overall a huge disappointment. And $16 for a burger and fries?? We will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Medium well&#34;

7F_3MQzinCFRb3ein91QFg.text: We made reservations for 20 and our group went to 35! The food was delicious.  The staff was accommodating. Drinks and service was efficient! You can relax, watch the game, and chill with friends.

qg0qirRK29Slh_gEMjIw9A.text: The Food -   3.5 - The Fish Sandwich had salmon as its protein, it was missing something but I couldn't say what. It also had pickled onions, lettuce, and tartar sauce, the bun was good.  5 - The Zucchini Fries were excellent. The dipping sauce was excellent. I would order again and again.   3 - The Cauliflower Gratin was ok. It was lukewarm but it had cheese so..... it was fine.   3.8 The Atmosphere was very bar like, with TVs indoors and outdoors. It reminded me of a mix between Hopdoddy and RnR, add in some unique and eclectic Alice in Wonderland style decor. I think I spotted one restoration hardware chandelier that, while beautiful, clashed a bit with the lacquer faux animal heads and white street lamps.  Overall score - 3.825 (I'll round up to 4 since they just opened)  I would try them again, this was their opening night and I am betting as they mature it will be better. I would say since it's more of a Chop House, I plan on trying a burger or piece of meat next time.   Service was great, friendly staff, they are still learning their menu and some items were not in stock yet. Meh.

iqkG4fZ3VNoINhWuALtjSg.text: Great new place! Staff is friendly and helpful. Super cool concept and there is something on the menu for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drink menu. They also have reverse happy hour Friday and Saturday 9pm- Close

OBpomGpKWTL7L7zncXlWWg.text: Yum! Tried this place purely on the aesthetic of the outside, but stayed for the food! I ordered the California burger and our table shared the salt & vinegar fries. Both were high quality and enjoyed by everyone at the table. Staff was very friendly and the location is convenient next to Fashion Square mall. Will be back :)

pIJzIGWDJT7bjJQFXECq3Q.text: Great place with good ambiance and doesn't get crazy busy like other restaurants in the area. Had the 12 oz. Porterhouse with Blue cheese crumbles on it. Seriously one of the better steaks I have had in a while. My wife had the Filet with garlic butter and she loved it. Cook temps were spot on and the staff was great.

ZULpk1Ci4DhBxOTlXYjt2w.text: This is BY FAR, one of the best restaurants I have been to in Arizona! The interior design itself is beautiful, balanced, and unique. I love a restaurant with a great atmosphere and Hand Cut embodies that, not to mention amazing food.   I went in for lunch and ordered the Western Burger. The meat was cooked to perfection and the whole burger itself was flavorful, juicy, and the perfect size! The service was excellent and my server know everything about the menu and more! I will definitely be coming in again!  Can't wait to try even more things on the menu, Hand Cut is truly an amazing new concept.

fU3Hkuh-8yVovC224Ucl-w.text: I really hope to come back and update, but they have some major customer service flubs to overcome. Right off the bat, the hostess was very flustered. She was definitely giving off some serious anxious vibes.   Our waitress was very nice and attentive, but she was definitely spread way too thin. She had tables all over the entire restaurant and I think was pretty stressed about it. Regardless, she was on top of it with getting our orders and refilling drinks, etc. This always really annoys me, as I think it's a huge management flaw - i.e. they are too cheap to have enough staff working at once. It's a Thursday in Old Town in the Spring, you gotta anticipate a lot of people coming in.   The main issue was how SLOW the kitchen was. It was decently busy - definitely nothing crazy though. We were sat about 7:15 (Thurs night) and it was probably a little over half-full inside. We ordered the artichoke dip app and it took quite a while to get it. The worst, though, was that it took over an HOUR to get two burgers. They were just normal, right off the menu, burgers with no special modifications. My friend and I were getting pretty hangry. It was nearing 9 PM and our casual, quick bite was turning into a looooong dinner (with no food). Finally, my friend stopped who I think was the manager and asked her if our food was coming soon. She was super nice and quickly came back with our food. She was apologetic about it and even comped part of our bill.   The food itself was really yummy. I got the mushroom burger with an egg, and it was cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor.   Since the food is so delicious, the ambiance is cute, and the location is great, I would probably come back and give it another try. I hope they speed up the kitchen ASAP and properly staff up!

RVh8MK0xWP386SDvBGw_jQ.text: The venison was good. But all the appetizers and sides were insanely salty. And I don't usually mind seasoning. Several people in our group had the same complaint. I'm talking every single dish of 8 side dishes.

oyGuCiMuOOuCLuw2BtJKYw.text: Wow wish I would have tired sooner! Had the Cali burger on a lettuce wrap. Great flavors cooked perfectly and was hot! Salt and vinegar fried hit the spot too. The wings were good, had a little honey flavoring on the end!

7V2IdRiuXvvHR20fQ9ScZw.text: The Cloud LGS team chose Hand Cut Burgers for its location and selection of delicious sounding burgers. We had a team of 12 sitting for lunch and we all loved our food. The staff were very accommodating to our large group and was on top of all of our orders.   The food was so good there was a moment where we weren't looking at our phones or talking, just purely enjoying the moment.

fTnXS8xrBv_eXAd1dW1NMw.text: Just had one of the worst meals ever. Servers didn't seem to care if we existed. Used a cocktail napkin as our only napkin until we decided it would really be nice to have silverware, so we went to another table and "stole"some. Won't be going back.

YxlwZ_SXulRor0K8Wa8-oA.text: First time going.  Probably the best burger I've had in Scottsdale  since I moved here 2 years ago.  Amazing service.  Accidentally ordered the wrong burger.  They sent me a new one pronto, let us keep the wrongly ordered burger and didnt charge us for either.  And...They know how to do sweet potato fries!  Worth it.  Make a reservation though.

YRLkIH80cVUsCbME1VeZiQ.text: What a fun location with delicious food! The decor was fun and the service was perfect! We tried multiple dishes and appetizers between our party of five and all were good. My favorites were the zucchini fries, chicken melt sandwich and the super yummy sweet potato gratin! My husband loved his classic burger. Our family of five never gets to sit in a booth, so we loved their deep booths and my son loved all the TVs . Nothing bad to say. Highly recommend.

pIJdSiNzaL-LHC8nUY-yDg.text: I thought this place was great.  We called on short notice with a party of 10 and they were able to accommodate. We shared the sweet potato fries and salt & vinegar fries.  Both were delicious.  I got the jalapeno burger and it was just right.

s58we99-E3GWYWMth3qbZg.text: My fiance and I went here for dinner last week and it was awesome! Very modern atmosphere, awesome service, delicious food. Our waitress was knowledgeable and helped us choose what to order. I cant remember which cocktail I got but it was perfect - not too strong. For appetizer we got the salt and vinegar fries (a favorite) and spinach dip. Would definitely order the fries again, but probably not the spinach dip. Originally, the fries didn't sound like something I would normally order but our waitress talked us into it and they were awesome! For dinner, I got the crispy chicken sandwich and my fiance got the blue cheese burger. Both were fantastic and very generous sizes. We will definitely be back!

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salt and vinegar fries - favorite!

bILJ2rO8oVS56rRPg44eQw.text: It takes a lot for me to rate a place as one star. This joint qualifies.  This was my second visit here and the experiences quite similar.  Both times (~ 6pm for dinner) it took 40 minutes for the food to arrive.  This last visit a few days ago, not only did the food arrive late as usual, but 3 out of 3 "medium rare" grass fed burger patties were visibly burnt on both sides and very dry overall. I'd say they were cooked Well++.  2 of the burger buns were crushed. The manager and server seemed surprised that it would arrive so crushed, but that was a fake response. I know why, I just didn't tell them I saw what happened - one of the lamps they use to keep your food warm while they figure out their mess in the kitchen fell on the burgers and left a dent along the outer line of the lamp base.  We also ordered chicken wings. They were also very dry and sat there for a long time before delivered to our table.  We were short on time and opted to just stay and nibble at this food. The kids did not finish their meals.  The manager was sympathetic and took 15% off the bill. Any manager that knows what they're doing would have immediately comp'd the entire meal. This was crappy food that should have NEVER left the kitchen on its way to a patron. Who knows what else they mess up that we can't immediately tell visually.  This place can not be trusted. This place is hyped up but does not live up to it, not even close.

dSm90Ho9LlEgqpk11_ov4w.text: Great sweet potato fries and burgers! Amazing service, especially from our server Maddy!

3baKuXeYnZYLqOyw4iAYiQ.text: The attention to detail for this place is impeccable.  You can tell the owner sat in every nook and cranny and made sure that it had something artistic to offer.   The atmosphere was cool, with dim lights and a DJ playing some 80's hip hop.    The food was great and service was exemplary.  Sarah, our waitress, was especially bright and kind and treated us like royalty. (My only critique was that the Jalapenos on my burger were weak, but it's Scottsdale and I am Hispanic, so whatevs.)

3eVYWqqASLVEA1PQyf3PeA.text: Me and my wife to dinner there on Saturday night with some friends and we highly recommend it. We were in town from LA and found this place on yelp. The environment was great, they had a DJ playing good hits while people were having drinks and dinner. Food was amazing, we had the steak, chicken breast and western burger.

vNrXwdHZvh6b9N0fqA1YLg.text: Went for lunch. Service was slow. Food was good, not great but good. For the price I wouldn't be in a rush to get back but I would go back if in the area.

OZfSa3Xner4QGScTSioK9g.text: This place has such a cool vibe. Unfortunately, the food was not what I had hoped. Ordered two burgers. One sat up in the window for around 10mins...with our fries. When it was delivered to us it was over cooked. We sent it back and the cook said it was mid rare. It was hardly pink. They refused to make a new one.   The overall wait time for the food was 45min. There were several open tables so it wasn't that busy. Several times I saw the cook in the back text messaging on his phone.  My soda was empty during most of my meal. The waitress never came back to check on us, we had to have a runner help us.  This place is in a great location, has a cool vibe...yet...will soon be out of business if customers get the service we did.  I won't be going back.  --------------------------------- So I went back...and really happy I did. Tuesday's 1/2 price cuts are a great deal. Don't miss out

DQ1BCVQyhiMHSH4JvyLQCA.text: Food was delicious and service was prompt! I mentioned one dish being too salty and the manager came and dropped off the bill and really took in my opinion of the dish and thanked us for choosing his restaurant and invited us back with a couple of coupon cards!

1ywymHaaNEuj5fcMdNNjAw.text: Lunch was nice. Liked the experience and staff were very good. Salt & vinegar fries was my favorite.  Good, but not *great*. I'd go back again.

iULApWulNIDN0Oe5fwEgrQ.text: First time. Very good. We split the burger and the chicken salad and both were very good. The burger was top 5 definitely.  The salt and vinegar fries were my favorite and I don't love fries. Danielle was a great bartender and took awesome care of us. One downside was a wall of unique bourbons that were not on the menu. Very annoying. One my favorites and will be back and maybe the bourbon can come off the wall. P.S

-cFP1aD1BLGIDCtSSZPF6w.text: This place was amazing. I can't wait to go back! Food was amazing and a very nice rustic decor!

3XW_IlRBr9JK-adE_Vt7Qw.text: The service at this place was terrible. Not only did it take four times as long as it should have to get mediocre food, but they brought it with an attitude. No wonder they've got half a dozen open tables on a Saturday night. As far as my money is concerned, I'll go elsewhere. Good luck to the owners.

UA7cQF3A6B3A7mojQS9aTA.text: Great service and good atmosphere. The burgers are flavorful and juicy. They have a DJ on Friday and Saturday

n3bzUOGaGIL8M9cyYqQTCg.text: This is a nice place for happy hour. One issue last night when four of us went at 5 pm, they were out of the happy hour white wine. There was no offer for a substitute white, maybe $2 off another brand. The normal hh wine is $5. Other wines begin at $10.  The zucchini fries are exceptional. The wings were also delicious and the helpings are generous. Next time if the white isn't available, I will go elsewhere rather than settling for a glass of red I didn't care for.

n61KduD_wsVNj0tluFt0XA.text: Really good and fresh.  I had a chicken wrap, green ice tea and salt and vinegar fries.  Very hip atmosphere.  Excellent service, I will definitely be back.

R44CtarYOb-C3bCAUYmzMA.text: First time here and what a great date night hang out complete with crafty cocktails and a DJ to keep the vibe alive. THE BEST BURRATA EVER! Seriously a must try if you love beets and arugula and burrata of course. The veal chop was also a favorite so rich and tender. Seared to perfection on the outside and a beautiful medium rare on the inside juicy good!  The deconstructed wedge salad had me worried but the creamy blue cheese, tart apples and meaty bacon were classic wedge wowza!  Hubby's yelp check in got us a free order of salt and vinegar fries yum! The truffle butter mashed potatoes tho! Omg! The evening ended with a salted Carmel butter cake with roasted peaches and vanilla bean ice cream. Yup.  Atmosphere 5, service 5 and food super 5!

B6c-4IFDvnVA8pOxDE2Kyg.text: It's just yummy!  I have been a few times for lunch and always get the B.F.D. which includes a burger, fries, and drink for $12 which is a great value as its so delicious!  Went for the first time on Friday for dinner and it was packed but we quickly found space at the bar and it was on.  We ordered the Beets & Burrata which is wonderful combination of the creamiest, softest cheese and perfectly cooked beets paired with a wonderfully sweet sauce to bring it home!  We also ordered the Flank Steak and Classic Burger on a lettuce wrap.  This was paired with their amazing Salt and Vinegar Fries which comes with this delicious dill ranch dipping sauce gloriousness.  It is amazing and a must-order!

GVqYGvfTX2YKZxJg8tLTAA.text: Delicious, delicious.   So, me and (Tom ) Brady walk by a lot and very often. It's got rando sheep and decent feng shui. All the evidence pointed towards edible food...  So, I stroll in on a Saturday night. Table for uno Homo sapiens and pup stays ADA compliant in a bag..., we get set up on a table and we walk by appx 12-13 hot people. As a hot person, I can say what imma about to say:  "I thought the food and drink was going to suck because hot people either make it bad or reaaaaalllly great."  There's no in-between. Hot people can be prejudiced against hawt people. PAC 10 alums can rip on Pac-12. Chinese people can tweet the most racist things about the delicious food at PF Chang's. I can let you know about the fact that hot servers, hawt food runners, good looking bus staff and hot chefs could have been a flock of sheeep (pun intended :-)   Good news for you equals the food and drink are delightful!!! Get the tar-tare sans arugula. Get the burgers rare. Get the ginger beer in a chilled glass

QZmZeUwZSh0YXd6tqatj0Q.text: This was a great find located near the Fiesta Bowl Museum. Stopped in around 11 since I was still on EST (2pm) and there were a good amount of people. Everything here is a la carte. I opted for a Western Bacon Burger and Salt and Vinegar fries (free with check in on Yelp). My server Revy was outstanding. He was also working the bar and still made the extra effort to check on things. Food was great and there were plenty of sports on TV.

z116RaUx5hHAExEBbcS1yg.text: As you can tell I couldn't wait to eat the chicken sandwich  bc i couldn't even get a picture, lol. My friend and i split half the chicken sandwich and half of I believe the Cali burger ?  Ahhhh-mazing. Both of them. I think I liked the burger better though.   Let's talk about those FRIES. Some of the best fries I think I've actually ever had. I'd go there and just order those tbh. So good with the aioli!   Mac and cheese was super good but I've had better.   Waitress was rude and not very helpful with questions. Seemed "too good" to be there" so that drops my rating to a 4 Star from 5.

BW-Wz53WpArtq4hwS7Pe0g.text: Whoa! A first for me! 2x at the same restaurant in 91.5 hours (won't make it a habit due to a 26 mile drive across Phoenix). :o  I started with a Blackberry Mojito and Tempura Zucchini Fries (yummy).  However, I was a bit disappointed for a bit, as I went here for the Fillet Mignon. But, was given a lunch menu. Luckily, when I asked my waitress if I could order off the dinner menu, she said no problem. :)  So, I ordered that, medium rare, of course, with garlic mushrooms and grilled asparagus.  The meal was superb. Everything arrived hot. The fillet practically melted in my mouth.   The service wasn't quite at the level that I had on the first visit. But, it was still great service.  I'll be back. I just wish I lived closer to them.

D5zjNm3WwCvFxThUHzuNvg.text: I'd rate this place higher because the service was really great, but the food was so bad I just can't. I was actually walking away from the restaurant after eating and thinking "wow that was gross".  Jalisco Valley Bramble ($8 HH) - Tequila and blackberry liqueur, with mint and lemon. This was really great, it was a little sweet but had nice flavor. 4/5  Mushroom Cheddar Burger ($10) - I absolutely love mushroom burgers and if I ever see one on a menu, that's what I'll order. Nothing beats a juicy burger with piles of mushrooms on it and that awesome mushroom flavor. Well this mushroom burger was TERRIBLE. They should rename it the "Balsamic Vinegar Burger" - because that is literally all I could taste. I was actually amazed at how I couldn't even taste any mushroom flavor given the amount of mushrooms on the burger. The menu states this burger is "drizzled with balsamic". Perhaps they should re-evaluate this statement. 0/5  Western Bacon Burger ($10) - The husband got this one and he liked it.  Sweet Potato Fries ($7) - This is another one of those unfortunate menu miscommunications. The menu states that the sweet potato fries are "served with chili-lime aioli". I wasn't sure if I'd like the dip but I knew that if I didn't, I could just eat the fries by themselves. I mean, how hard is it to f up sweet potato fries? When the waitress brought over this basket of fries, the smell was so overwhelming that I actually wanted to gag. The fries were absolutely completely COVERED in spices. I tentatively tried one and all I could taste was paprika. Tons and tons of paprika. It was absolutely disgusting. I tried them with the dip and that tasted even worse. I cannot believe that they wouldn't state on the menu that the fries are covered in this spice mix. 0/5

XKEaHiTuGaKaPy4c0tpnfQ.text: I wanted to give it 4 stars....but when you order a medium rare burger and it comes out medium well at a BURGER place that is not good....while the presentation was great, the service awesome,  it was very disappointing to not get what I had ordered.  The decor and ambiance is great. The brussel sprouts were delicious, and the salads were good but I felt overpriced for what you got.  Sorry...I wanted it to be better.

O4H5hwa8K0331gGcvRza-g.text: Good service, awesome food. They decor is great! My only issue is that i noticed everyone (employees) wearing a different pattern/colors in the restaurant so it's almost like you don't know who works there. I feel like they need to all kind of have the same colors on. Like the guy cutting vegetables was wearing a diamondbacks shirt... someone else in grey.. someone else wearing multi colored shirt... then someone wearing sweatpants I'm like dang so who actually works there? Lol.  But overall food was great....and our waitress was friendly. That's really what matters. But i would like to know who actually works there so they should figure out a color scheme for the staff.

6Nk2ahowrvqE7_neevF34A.text: Walking around waiting for apple store as you saw in review stumbled upon Hand Cut Burgers as you know not a meat person but they have a happy hour all day Sunday plus half off appetizers. Not a meat person but I do  like steak tartar.  Nate are bartender amazing patient supper busy but was still accommodating. Nice vibe in Scottsdale out of the zone but I'd come back. Had burrata amazing with yellow beets even better. Also house made smoked salmon. Because apple took 3 hrs  I had the benefit to transition from lunch to dinner. Steak tartar different they cook the egg u will want to make sure u clarify  runny cause even though the redid it still yolks over cooked. Its different won't order it again but not what I expected. A whole cooked egg on top of tartar.  Honestly not the best I've had. They should clarify Its a whole cooked egg on top of tartar.  They said raw egg not egg sunny side up. But otherwise what I had was good. I like the venue and people but tartar made them loose a star. Great place to go to ...just clarify what your ordering.

lh0_uB7iWfUcd6W2mFNZHQ.text: Great ambiance, design and menu. Highly recommend this restaurant for groups or dates. The energy spills over to the outdoor area.

W5XpdKxWlOgLjtWl8UmwZw.text: Since we went to their sister restaurant, Farm and Craft and thoroughly enjoyed the food, we thought we would give Hand Cut a try. Now, important note. My wife has Celiac disease so I'm always very, very careful to talk to a manager before we choose a restaurant.  When the manager and/or the wait staff use the phrase "a dedicated fryer" that's my benchmark for knowing what a gluten allergy is!!  I got the Rib Eye ( no surprise ) and my wife got the chicken. Mushrooms, grilled asparagus and a baked potato rounded out the dinner. The food was absolutely perfect. Medium rare on my steak and mushrooms were the perfect side. Small complaint. A touch too much salt. But truly, this is just my personal taste on food. I always under salt figuring that you can always ADD salt but can't take it away.  Parking is convenient. There's s great underground lot right next door. And the location we went too is on the Scottsdale Waterfront District and very beautiful. We actually parked across the canal and walked over just to enjoy the view. As far as chop houses go, I rant Hand Cut above average! Go give this place a try.  To Janessa, our waitress, thank you for being attentive and knowledgeable.

Yugki-RizcVUOFjtfAIWzw.text: Best bartender in town makes a killer old fashion. Great fries!

dcqkH3IhZzGd9k9a_kkBzw.text: I ordered the California Burger (burger done medium, avocado, Swiss cheese, sprouts, pickled red onions and herb aioli, topped with crisp sweet potato strings) and Salt & Vinegar Fries with Dill Ranch fry sauce. DELICIOUS.  The vinegar fries with dill ranch were a revelation, and the burger was well-balanced and a treat to eat. I highly recommend these items!   When you go, tell them Joshua S. sent you! You'll get a confused look.

ONqeEEO8q8Ob-1IiAiVm_A.text: Going to give them at least 2 stars because maybe I came on a bad night. However, there are other things about this place that they should fix to make for a better diner experience.  Anyway, the wife and I came on a Saturday evening and I ordered the Western Bacon burger and my wife ordered the Crispy Chicken sandwich. My burger was unimpressive... I mean I can get a better burger at The Habit (fast food) and for a lot less! My wife's Crispy Chicken was crispy alright, over-cooked crispy. If you like chicken jerky, you'll love this sandwich but if not, then you'd be disappointed as my wife was.   She also had The Matador signature cocktail which was good but weak on the alcohol. I had a Fresh Squeezed IPA which was good but pour was small (maybe 12 oz) and whoever poured needs to learn how to pour IPAs as it had a big head on it which resulted in 1/4 loss of actual beer. That's very important for beer lovers as myself.  Now, something they should fix - 2 single bathrooms right next to open kitchen. First of all, how can you have so little bathroom space for a place that is selling so many alcoholic drinks? And secondly, right next to an open kitchen? I was waiting in line for vacant bathroom 3 feet away from food that was being prepared. That's gross!  Finally, the place seems to be a draw for Millennials. Nothing wrong with that but if you are in your 50's as me and the wife are, you may not enjoy dining with a room full of mostly noisy Millennial guys. Just sayin. :-)  So, tried it, didn't like it and won't be back. Hope you guys make some improvements as the location (Scottsdale Waterfront) is great.

lmKje0lYIH6Sr3VOAiOJiw.text: I love the ambiance of this place! Our waitress was highly attentive and informed on the menu.   My filet was perfectly prepared. The mashed potatoes and fries were great. I like that the sides are intended to share.

XpmsWZgdFszZKbMR1PaEjw.text: The quality of food seems to have gone down a bit from when they opened. But overall I've enjoyed most of my experiences there. Plus they do half price bottle wines and select cuts on Tuesday's. Atmosphere is nice as well

r8HyL8MqjUq15wDmwu9yUA.text: The food is actually pretty good, but I had some serious concerns about the staffs ability to handle food allergies. I alerted my waitress of an allergy to dairy (not preference- allergy) when we got there, and again when I ordered. When I received my food, it was fortunate that my sister noticed it looked like they had put cheese on my burger. I opened up the bun, and sure enough, there were remnants of pieces of cheese like they had put cheese on and scraped it off at the last minute. This is not just unacceptable, but dangerous. Hiding the fact that an allergen had been placed in my food and then serving it anyway is incredibly irresponsible. We alerted the staff, and they remade my food and comped our bill... so at least they knew a big mistake had been made. Out of sheer fear of it happening again, however, I will not be eating here again.

eKBfQNr-lbhkk5ca3QopTA.text: So many things wrong with this place and too many great restaurants nearby to return here!   1. Order a buffalo trace bourbon old fashioned as I noticed several bottles of buffalo trace bourbon displayed around the bar and restaurant. I then am approached by a sommelier with a bad attitude who tells me "those are just for display." Really it's a $25 bottle of bourbon, it should be for sale. So stupid and unaccommodating.   2. Filet was over cooked. Ordered medium and it came out well done.   3. One men's and one women's single bathroom for the entire restaurant and bar. There was a line outside of both bathrooms and when I asked if there was any more bathrooms, I was told no because this building was previously a clothing store and bathrooms were not needed. Well guess what you started a restaurant in old town and you have two single facilities for the entire place. Big time fail!  Lastly I was ill all night suspiciously from the food. I will never return under any circumstances. My money will be better spent elsewhere and so should yours.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The &#34;display whiskey selection,&#34; but don&#39;t choose any of these as they are not available. Also no whiskey list, so you have to guess

nupxA0w8UlCiGJRAouc0Hw.text: I came here with my family after finding a great cash back deal on Groupon and it was so worth it. The  service was outstanding and the food was well prepared presented and delicious The staff and management was very intent and courteous . Overall a 5 star review and a definite recommendation for all who come here after me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hbAhNNOsaSc3Hg1tYySWbQ.text: Service is always five stars, very cool and open vibe at the bar or at a table..no stuffy dining room happening here. I love the burgers, always get it without the bun and never miss it. The Asparagus is always perfectly charred and full of flavor.

afluUdBmn3cTxVYriaSn0g.text: Went here yesterday for an early dinner and loved it! The decor and vibe of the restaurant was really different than most places I've been to which is what initially made the experience a good one. I got the 8 oz steak and then we got grilled asparagus and truffle mashed potatoes for the table to share. Everything was delicious, the server was great, and an amazing location. I would recommend Hand Cut to family and friends!

g-Elsftq3uwBlVhVNkQZ1Q.text: This place is a must if you are in the Oldtown Scottsdale area! The atmosphere is trendy and fun but you can still hear yourself and have conversation with the people around you! The Zucchini fries and truffled mash potatoes are out of this world! Their house Cab- Drumheller is unreal, I started with one glass and we ended up ordering a bottle for the table! Great service you can't go wrong!

gWsC6zlbr9D7GWzGHmxOMg.text: Heard about this from my shopper at Nordstrom.  Can't believe I had not heard of this place.  Trendy but chill and the staff was very passionate about the menu.  Trust me, you want to ask for a recommendation from the staff and order it with the substitutions they suggest.  Definitely my new "go to" place that is close to home.

1sMZP6MpoRxGTBMvapt0Nw.text: This has been the slowest, worst experience I have had at a restaurant in a long time. We got here at 1:30 to eat lunch before our 3:00 appointment, but got 3 plates of incorrect food (we have food allergies) at 2:45. It is not busy in here. There is no excuse for this. I will never eat here again.  Edit: the staff did comp our meal, and I had an email exchange with someone in response to this review (assuming owner or manager?). The staff did do their best to handle the situation after it had happened, and the owner/ manager did have genuine interest in making the situation better.

6AO-pdlfFFtDzV4XDSlopQ.text: Hand cut is so beautiful on the inside and everyone is so nice. However the steak isn't that great for the price. I'd rather pay a little extra and go to a Mastros for a steak.  Also, I've had exactly every appetizer on the menu and nothing is worth having again. I find myself at this place more than I'd like because the cocktails are excellent and the vibes are just so trendy.  PS do not try the steak tar tar it's probably the worst thing I've ever had and I've had it at a couple other places so I know what it can taste like and well no just don't.

1J-1zZ2SnHaVUDTCtxDNjQ.text: First time visit yesterday and glad we stopped by. Sunday evening, the place was not busy so walked right in. Service was spot on, friendly and attentive. While their drink menu was very interesting except for me, our party stuck with soft drinks. I had a pour of good rye whisky, a good pairing with one of their excellent burgers. We all had burgers of one form or another. I had mushroom cheddar, wife had classic, the the two others in our party had the jalapeno burger. We all had dill and vinegar fries. Everything was excellent. Juicy burgers with lots of toppings and fries were very tasty.   Good food, good service and good prices. Definitely will return.

zkABWaZQiUxnJpaulXjsfw.text: This place was delicious and very friendly staff. I tried the jalapeno burger which wasn't too spicy but perfect and full of flavor. My boyfriend got the BBQ burger and really enjoyed it as well. The star of the meal was the salt and vinegar fries though...I loved them!! Onion rings are pretty good too but we only got 4 with a small order. I plan to eat here again next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeño burger, salt &amp; vinegar fries and onion rings

E2t4Vn9Hl9bbKR6ytkoqtQ.text: Stopped in for a late afternoon snack after shopping on Saturday...glad we did.   Interesting atmosphere, comfortable (padded) booths, good food and cold drinks!   Wife & I split a mushroom/cheeseburger, which arrived cut in 1/2 on 2 plates (nice!), small sides of fries & onion rings, and cold beer for each of us...it was 106* that afternoon..whew!  Everything was excellent!  Burger was outstanding, vinegar & sea salt fries and onion rings were just the right portions for us.   Excellent service from the staff, even though it was during the mid-afternoon lull at 3:00 pm. We'll definitely be back to try the steak menu.  Great place to bring friends too for a really good burger!

GvsAuvDHysHOAcM5Y46iOA.text: 5 stars Plus & many more. The Happy Hour food is amazing.Burgers is made of midwestern real Beef, steak salad, sides & appetizers are out of this world.  The servers are Outstanding,Brandon,Jesse,Nathan are out of this world. No Babies & Kids are to come here at all.  Enjoy the RomanticAmbiance

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vlGAZd1k-uNbOZmo9xtZTQ.text: Service was kind of slow... the food we ordered was good though! The burgers are smaller portions as well as the salads, but filling if you aren't crazy hungry. The fries are okay and good for sharing. I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant! It has modern/hip decor and nice seating.

eKPjyfVQ-ZQYWc4Xhwn8jw.text: Wow! First time here and we loved it! Salmon was tender and so flavorful. Surf and turf was delicious. 1/2 off on Tuesdays and so are the bottles of wine. We sat at the bar and had very friendly service.

WLGkJoH-xClsgUwjhR-sbw.text: Grass fed beef not seasoned well, so fairly tasteless. Asked for ice tea that never arrived.  Not a stellar lunch.

1JznzAB9sSKRU7DsDs525Q.text: I had not heard of this restaurant before, but it was featured on ABC 15's Smart Shopper for its "Half Chop" Tuesdays, which means that every Tuesday night after 6 p.m. You can order almost anything off the chops part of the menu for half price! Wines by the bottle are also half price! I was looking for somewhere new and fun to celebrate my son's 15th birthday, so I contacted the GM who was very helpful and we went last night for dinner.  This restaurant is located at the very trendy Waterfront at Scottsdale Fashion Square. Whoever did the interior design did a fantastic job...kind of Kelly Wearstler meets Philippe Starck for the design mavens out there . It definitely appealed to the designer in me.  Our server, Sarah was just fantastic! She was so sweet and knowledgeable . She recommended a great red blend called Motto Gung Ho, and I was able to order the bottle at $14.  I ordered the filet MR+ and added blue cheese crumbles. It was one of the most tender cuts I've had,  and perfectly prepared! Dishes are served a la  carte, and I ordered roasted cauliflower in a Parmesan cream sauce to accompany my steak.  My son had the roast chicken breast with the macaroni carbonara, and he was not disappointed! We had dessert too...a homemade chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich and the butter cake  with salted Carmel and roasted peaches. So yummy! We had another great server, Kylie, who opened the wine and let us know about the burger and drink special for $10 each weekday until 3:00.  I will definitely be returning to try out the burgers, which are all grass fed beef btw.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the Hollywood Glam vibe of the decor!
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Celebrating my son&#39;s 15th birthday at Hand Cut Chop House.

q73aOVJhCnfzrU_9qt4Y8A.text: Roasted cauliflower was amazing. Craft Cocktails good as well. Nice atmosphere. Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fcGPj7UrrjiKh7DRVCKFKg.text: My son raves about this restaurant so while visiting him over the weekend he took me here. I wish I could base my experience on the food... drinks.... water for that matter.  I cant because we never had a server come to our table.  When we arrived we were told it was a 2 hour wait. From the host stand we could see the restaurant was half full at best. We were deciding where else we could go and a different host approached us and said she could clean a table for us and seat us immediately  We were sat... and we literally sat for 23 minutes without being greeted by a server. Looking around there were at least 6 tables that also had no service. One person in our party used the men's restroom and said there were no towels or dryer for his hands. Instead there was a roll of toilet paper sitting next to the sink. He used that to dry his hands. Before we left I asked a host to speak with a manager her answer " she is here somewhere but we can never find her". You lost a $400 table last night and could not find a manager to try to correct the issues

EmbORcTKUicuGSKvY4otCg.text: Been here twice and both times the food was incredibly disappointing.  Salmon appetizer was a complete mess. Burger was dry and salty.   Not going to bother giving it a 3rd try.

OJNdoieTAGqfj3NB4d5yeA.text: GREAT steak and good salmon. The staff went above and beyond to support me with sides because I am allergic to gluten. The food is awesome!   Wonderful environment, love the decor and they had a DJ while we were eating it was so cool!!!!   We highly recommend it:) Especially if you are in the mood for a burger or steak!   Coming back for wine next time:)

pnhUeX2LVZWCNAb9X0mBKA.text: It has been a rough month as far as dining experiences go unfortunately and things did not change with this one.   Earlier in the month some friends said they had heard good things about this place and we walked in on a week night. It was easy to find, great modern decor and was a very clean and nice looking restaurant.   The hostess up front was nice and got us sat right away.   Here's where they lost me. It just took so long to get everything out and our server was visibly frustrated which I understand but at the same time it's probably not best to show that to the customer. We ordered appetizer's and got some wings and the salmon while my two friends got some drinks. The drinks came out really quick. The food did not.   Then on to entree's. Mind you they came out around 35-40 mins after our appetizers came out. About 20 minutes into the wait for the entrees it felt like our server would actively avoid us, walk past the table very quickly and not make eye contact. We were very calm but it was incredibly apparent that some of their other tables were very difficult to deal with. Two of us got steaks and the other got a sandwich. Some form of short rib sandwich. The steaks were cooked very unevenly. One side was rare and the other was well done. It was very strange.   The rib sandwich though was good apparently according to my friend. So there's that.  Either way. Rough night all around. Once the bill came we just dropped the cash on the table and ran. Can't see this place making itself into the rotation.

35qoJq6MBnd1sv0xGFbI6g.text: First timers -- cute place!!    Welcomed by the hostess, sat at a great booth with lots of room.  Always nice for a roomie booth.  Was greeted by the server and we told her it was our first time.  She gave some suggestions which is always appreciated.  All went down from here....  Started with the tempura zucchini.  This was good!! Crisp outside and tender inside.  This was the only thing worth eating...here is the rest.....  I got the western burger, hubby the mushroom cheddar and my nephew the chop classic burger -- all cold with sale buns!  We got the creamer corn...cold, good flavor but could have been way better if hot and creamy as the menu states.  Salt and vinegar fries were sent back...cold.  Bacon Mac and cheese...cold.  Ok let me explain why so frustrating -- it is a Monday night.  There are 4 other tables and some peeps at the bar all here before us.    Service was pitiful.  There were at least 2-3 servers for 4 tables.  Our server was annoyed with us and flat out rude.  Everything we asked was bothersome to her.  Drinks were empty most of meal, but she had a good chat session with a friend at the bar.  She was there every second she could be -- not a good thing to see when ur drink is empty.  She cleared all out plates and still took 20+ minutes to bring the bill.   I wish it was a better review/experience, great location.  Overall Impression -- pass.  Too many other great restaurants to settle for cold food.

ZaXm-RCkIhuSQGZsbbeeNw.text: Came with a work group of 7.  We shared salads and sides to share.  All were a hit.  The Bacon Mac and Cheese was especially good.  I got a Sazerac and a Strawberry Crush for my beverages. Both were delicious.  The Strawberry Crush was a good dessert cocktail for me.  Definitely would come again next time I'm in Scottsdale.

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creamed Corn
