LE8d_D45rjalWBQFBoLE-w.text: I'm going to preface this review by saying that I will go back and order a steak or burger and update my review after trying those dishes.   I had the chance to meet one of my favorite people for a quick dinner and drinks and we settled on Hand Cut. Love the location and the atmosphere. The patios feel like outdoor living rooms and the vibe is elevated but relaxed.   My girl ordered a regular burger and the sweet potato French fries and I ordered the loaded baked potato with chopped steak.   The food was eh. Mine was so unbelievably dry- even with butter and sour cream and bbq sauce. Even more butter and still- this just wasn't working. Like the Sahara of baked potatoes. Less than one star.   My drink tho. Friends. Friends, do yourself a favor and immediately only order black berry mojitos here for the rest of your life. It was like an adult beverage snowcone of happiness. Made me way less irritated about the potato. 5 stars for blackberry satisfaction in a glass.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best blackberry mojito I&#39;ve ever had.

PIQ0Jwm2W-8gEMZN3MOaCQ.text: Happened upon this gem looking for a drink after shopping.  Sat at the bar and was greeted by Kylie with the rockin eyelashes.  Wife had a blackberry mojito which was fantastic and my Titos were on point.  Also decided to try the B.A.N.A.N.A which was really good. Somewhat disappointed in the apps we got however.  Zucchini fries were decent but left a pile of grease on the plate.  Maybe a smaller cut and less batter would suffice.  Also had the smoked salmon which had a great mix of toppings but the bread was so thick it ate like a sandwich.  Don't get me wrong, the bread was fantastic and could stand on it's own but together was a little much.  Would definitely go back for the drinks and friendly atmosphere and give other menu items a try.

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ughkEuszoIDZitsPBuZxRw.text: We stopped in to grab dinner and drinks never having heard of this place.  We were able to grab 2 seats at the bar on Saturday night around 9p and felt lucky- the place was packed.  We were served promptly with extremely friendly service by Emily and Nicole!   They were able to keep food and drinks moving for a full bar.  We had a burger and a  short rib dip which were both perfectly cooked.  Happy hour on a Saturday was a huge plus.  The only slight downside is that they have a huge collection of whiskeys that they won't sell to patrons- we were told they were for decoration only.

dFM53_MX5mPNdDh2dwy1IQ.text: I loved this new burger joint!  I did knock off one star because the hostess was pretty rude, such an awkward experience. It makes such an uncomfortable vibe when entering and leaving when the hostess isn't friendly.  However, our waitress was great. Sweet and bubbly. She took our orders quickly which I loved! I got the black bean burger which was delicious! The buns fluffy and soft, the black bean patty was fresh and so flavorful! I loved the sauce and also the avocado and cheese was a nice touch!  When you check in on yelp they give you a free basket of fries and those were delicious as well! We will come back the next time we visit AZ.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HlzO1upWIgUDiAhspKThdg.text: We went here yesterday for lunch. Not busy (AT ALL)we walk in and the greeter/ waitress walks right by us without even saying hello. I thought ok that's rude, but since I had family in I kept to myself. The manager I think then approached us to seat us a few minutes later but then I realized my greeter was my WAITRESS too! She is a kind girl but we did not have good service, she would go missing to do other task for the restaurant as I don't think this is even her job title. The food was ok but my daughters chicken sandwich was chewy, mine wasn't even made how I wanted it and when I tried to explain, but she didn't even seem to comprehend what I was saying so , I said forget it.   Overall I was there for family time, but this isn't someplace that has me wanting to come back with service like that. Oh

UBOPou5xoUQOHBXe8_PtqQ.text: Very meh food: the salt and vinegar fries didn't taste like anything except dill, the California burger was super rich without any fresh flavors to balance it out, and my friend ordered the flank steak and it literally came with raw spinach just thrown onto the plate as a side. To make things much worse, the kitchen literally took 45 minutes to get our entrees out. The waitress was great, but unfortunately she couldn't make up for how slow the kitchen was. Definitely a bummer about the food because there was a cool vibe with a live DJ in the restaurant.

L8dkQ-d6RELDNQsizg_R4A.text: Nice ambiance, booths-large horseshoe bar-tables laid out for a place to be seen in. Menu has lots of tasty burger choices , featuring Arizona beef, plus cuts of meat. Our table really enjoyed the local beer selection, although due to great choices no one winner was declared.  We were seated in a large elevated booth (6 of us) towards the kitchen so we could watch the grilling. Just one change would have made the difference and one more star and that is lowering the music just a tad. This would enable our server and us not to have to repeat so often. For this visit, a miscommunication resulting in the barely eaten fries and sweet potato fries to be tossed versus boxed so the table was cleared for dessert. I was so looking forward to noshing these as a midnite snack.

yYPyvlrWex94DBhE7UgseQ.text: Came to this great spot for lunch and loved everything about it!! If you're looking for a great spot with an awesome vibe and really good food than this is your spot! The lunch menu is simple and sweet which is great when you're limited on time. I ordered the kale salad and omg it was delish! Such a great size, plenty of chicken and it wasn't drowning in dressing. The cauliflower also added an extra healthy crunch which I was happy about. My coworkers ordered the bbq burger and a grilled chicken burger and they both finished everything! I heard that the sweet potato fries are some of the best!!! My friend also mentioned that the dinner menu is great and has a lot of great variety so I am anxious to go back for dinner.  The atmosphere is what really had me the second we walked in! Such a great decor vibe all throughout with cool things to constantly look at and the space felt open, clean, fun, and welcoming! I could totally see myself back here with a group for brunch or drinks. The bar was huge and had a wide variety to choose from which is always a major plus! Overall I am soo excited about this place, our server was so sweet and attentive and the food a plus! I really can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

b-sJ5e9Bbc-HVJXJNdHjBA.text: I have heard many good things about the burgers at your location, living across the street I have had cocktails many time but never food.  The service is always pretty good which in Scottsdale that's sometimes hard to find.  I went to dinner there last night and we ordered the beets and burrata as an app and it was amazing.  About 45 minutes after we ordered our burgers came out (it did take a long time but the company was good so I didn't mind).  I ordered my grass fed burger medium and it came out extra well done and after waiting so long I didn't want to send it back.  I really wanted to love the burgers there but unfortunately I did not get what I ordered.  I'm not sure at this point if I would risk ordering a burger here again.  Just to reiterate though- the service was VERY good :)

HnvkXMU-1V7OF8a2M5WDXQ.text: This was not one of our best experiences at any restaurant that we had eaten at in Phoenix or the Scottsdale area.  First off, it was Black Friday, and here this restaurant is right across the street from a crazy busy mall and they don't have enough staff on hand.    We had a reservation so when we arrived a couple minutes early we were told that we would have to wait because they were running way behind because they didn't have enough staff on hand to seat us.  They did warn us that the kitchen was way backed up even though at the time we arrived it was not very crowded.  The best part of her meal with the fries that were season great and had fresh dill on them   Priscilla was our waitress and she did the best that she could do considering the lack of staff. Short rib dip, Was by far our favorite, crispy chicken sandwich was boring. Salt and vinegar dill french fries rocks! Grass fed beef ranch burger with jalapeno was not spicy and had no jalapeno flavor to it at all! Bulleit Mule was god, It's hard to mess that up!  With so many choices a fantastic restaurants I WOULD NOT bother going back.

Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vNtPkPINV3re_Ma4hs-pWg.text: I took a party of 7 here to celebrate father's day and a birthday. The servers were attentive and friendly, but the food took forever sometimes. There were some hits and misses: the hits - 1) western bbq burger was delicious and big enough to share if you don't have a big appetite 2) salt and vinegar fries were good. I would skip the spinach artichoke dip and the onion rings. I wasn't a fan. The yelp check in offer was a free large size of salt and vinegar fries and they gave a complimentary dessert for the birthday celebrant. The cookie dough bread pudding was good but very chocolatey. Overall, our bill was on the cheap side for our party so we gave a good generous tip. The restaurant has an awesome and trendy atmosphere so you should come down and visit!

lLBVzWYMpv4exQd58BenlA.text: Amazing date night pick! We've gone here three times now and I can only say great things!  Atmosphere was very modern and fun. We chose to sit in the booths where you can watch your food being prepared on the other side of floor to ceiling glass!  I had the best steak of my life here and the peach ambrosia drink was a fave.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peach ambrosia

bWQXgT7UWOYX4A0zbdiPxg.text: Decided to try this restaurant tonight. Servers were really attentive. We had several of the appetizers and have dinners and sides.   Appetizers: Wings: They were a little strange in flavor having tasting much of a sweet basil. I was not too happy about the flavor as they were very different from what I was expecting and an unusual flavor.  Spinach/Artichoke Dip: This is the best thing they have on the menu. The dip was creamy and the artichokes were caramelized almost having a garlic/onion flavor. Everyone was clamoring for more!  Zucchini: Pretty good, but if you don't like spice, please do not get them. They were a little more spicy than I would have liked.  Dinner: Flank Steak: Do not get the steak. We all had it and, while I know flank steak can be a tougher cut of meat, if cooked properly, it is not tough. They cut they meat with the grain which made it even tougher,  Sides: we had the asparagus, mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts all of which were pretty ordinary. They were trying to make them better by putting a ton of butter on all of them, but it did not help.  All-in-all, the service was fabulous! The servers know what they are doing. However, the only thing I tried that I absolutely loved was the dip.  Parking: Do not make a left at the restaurant or you will do some walking. Instead park in the parking garage on the right (west). The restaurant is almost right across the street.   I took some pictures of the restaurant since the locations looks pretty cool inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nothing like an iced cold soda to quench your thirst on a hot day!
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour deals
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from the table

RbyKDnmyCGouDfVsZlztbg.text: Normally I won't write a review for the restaurant that I never dine in. This place is an exception. It is because their burgers are so deliciously good!  We got the food from the delivery service. Since we lived not far from the restaurant, the food were still hot like just got out of the kitchen.  Mushroom cheddar burger is perfectly cooked. The medium beef patty is so delicious and I cannot stop enjoying it. Jalapeno ranch burger is also good with the same deliciously medium cooked beef. The large portion of salt & vinegar fries is also fresh and tasty.  We also ordered the dessert that come with ice cream. We were wondering at first on how they did pack them. When we got the order, we were so happy that they separate warm molten chocolate cherry cake from a scoop of ice cream. We did not have to deal with the melted ice cream. When we are ready to have a dessert, we just put the scoop of ice cream on top. Then boom! the warm cake meets the cold ice cream. They are so delicious and compliment each other.  Now this place is on our place to visit and dine in.

IuT28oJBaBpVecdDA4n2Jg.text: Fun & friendly atmosphere, young people doing a good job.  Revy was pleasant and engaging & stayed on top of things.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  We split the Chopped Salad with blueberry vinaigrette.  Unimpressive.  Her AZ grass-fed Classic burger was great, as was my AZ grass-fed California burger.  Juicy and delicious.  The salt & vinegar fries were too salty and could have used malt vinegar on the side instead of however they use the vinegar.  They are covered with an herb that tasted like dill-proving French fries will go with just about anything.  Just about.  We would say this is a place worth visiting again, but perhaps only for the atmosphere and service-we were both very sick in just about 2 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California burger
Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vxHoVd4BUK6loh3aJZmISw.text: Great spot!  The food was really good with lots of options for everyone.  We ordered the Kale Caesar and the Jalapeno Burger to share....both were super delicious.  Both of our kids had the Short Rib Dip and we all shared the Salt and Vinegar Fries.  Great quality food and really great flavors!  The offered gluten free options. There was also an option to upgrade your meat to a grass-fed, organic version for about $2 (at least for the burger, anyway). The ambience was nice but definitely more of a bar scene since the restaurant is kind of centered around the bar that sits in the center of the place.  The kitchen prep area is enclosed in glass so you can watch some food prep while you wait. Definitely recommend giving this place a try.

uRdUSBUx5DqK4-12yy9Orw.text: I had an amazing experience here the other evening out for drinks and dinner. I sat at the bar and happened to start talking to Matt Thompson, who is the beverage Director for Riot Hospitality Group. We got to talking, and he gave me great recommendations for drinks and food. I ended up ordering the tequila bramble, which was delicious. Matt himself went above and beyond to make sure my drink was made properly, and went out of his way to get me a drink that was so refreshing with the mint and blackberry liqueur. It was the perfect cocktail and I have Matt to thank for that! I also had the California burger which was cooked perfectly and the salt and vinegar fries were yummy as well.  The bar staff and everyone there was so great and helpful. Thank you to Matt and everyone for making it such a great evening. I'll be back again soon and hope to dine and visit all of the other Riot Hospitality locations.

Ehuzwoj-h26c0NwpBgyyyw.text: Read because I'm only giving 5 stars for one reason: Alexandra   I don't slay restaurants and don't post some stupid foodie-wannabe review reviling the lack of truffle and togarashi on my organic field green salad. That said I experienced some challenges tonight and my review centers on what went right vs. the less than ideal.   I took my family to eat, candidly because the place we wanted to eat claimed a 90 minute wait with no people in line and plenty of available tables (I digress), and we got seated with a good menu and the view of a TV for game. Unfortunately we ran into some issues but the measure of an individual and a company comes from challenge more than the norm.  When we experienced challenge Alexandra showed up and made everything right. She gets its, gets how to run a business, and gets how to ensure customers get taken care of with respect; not some hustle for an alterior motive. I can only say we would come back again just for her and, given a little tenure, I can promise she will run an establishment flawlessly.   Alexandra, we appreciate and admire what you do. Thank you and we will come back to see you any time.   - The Green Family

DRf_nFasuWkT-EGSdsScRQ.text: Great ambiance, the DJ was great on our Saturday night. The food and drinks were all excellent and great service.   We ordered:  -Cocktails -   -Jalisco Valley (blackberry),  -Agua caliente (strawberry). Highly recommend. -The Matador - sounded great on the menu but was lacking in flavor and we had to send it back.  -Wine-  Hunt and Harvest Cabernet. WOW. Amazing cab. Our waitress let me sample a few other reds and this blew everything else away.  -Main -  surf and turf. Amazing!!!!! Both were very delicious and cooked to perfection. Highly recommend.  -Sides - -Bacon Mac n cheese - Asparagus  -Sweet potato fries

NCAd-eEVUGOtJnP8L1wFQA.text: The food and service here is phenomenal! I can't say enough about how well we were treated and the burgs were to die for! Came from out of town and I have been to many places for burgers and I must say that this is one of the best. The salt and vinegar fries are a must have as well. Going back again before we leave town for another round!

QtY1f8RgLEMKeeNO8CebGg.text: The service was lagging a bit but the food was great. So many delicious options including plenty of beverage choices. The salt and vinegar fries were sooo good. Im not crazy about ordering my sides a la carte but the prices weren't too bad.

GuRepiAIgf3qGbxYiAgUxA.text: I have to say for a great,  grass fed, Arizona local real Beef burger dont even think about going anywhere else,  Hand Cut is my go to burger joint. When you first arrive the whole restaruant just feels alive,  it's open yet still cozy,  the kitchen and prep areas are also very visible from the seating area. This is particularly nice so you can really get a vibe for the employees,  the care and character of the food and the presentation.   We had great suggestions from our waitress on what to get, starter was Tempura Zucchini Fries (excellent not over fried), Western Burger (medium) ,  onion rings (perfect crunch with a soft and meaty inside) , my buddy had the Lobster Roll Burger,  which she will post a separate review (super yummy).   As we were waiting for our food to arrive Justin one of the owners, came to our table and told us he just passed by the window of the kitchen and saw our food and it was looking amazing,  he then went back and brought us our dinners.   Wow is the only way I can explain the table presentation and the first bite,  local organic,  grass fed,  sustainable Arizona beef is nothing short of amazing. The flavor was out of this world and unlike any burger I have had anywhere in the valley,  the BBQ sauce was unique and homemade and the roll was dynamite. All in all it was perfection to the last bite.    The must try dessert is the Butter Cake,  it is way better than the version at City Hall,  perfectly moist,  and sweet with a scoop of premium  ice cream on top.   I'd like to also add the rest of the staff at Hand Cut Burgers were, attentive, considerate,  and caring,  keeping up with my iced tea drinking problem very nicely.   Hand Cut Burgers, has now become my Favorite Arizona burger destination. Please guys don't change a thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wezCjOfRsYQymFgy71h8cw.text: Love this place! Great food and love their cocktail selection! Beets and burrata is my favorite, but also love their burgers and steak salad! I go for the drinks and stay for the food - yum!

ioF7LSrjNOlcl6rw1pwgzQ.text: I went with my family for an afternoon lunch and was blown away by the service and selection of food!   I had golden beets with a light mozzarella, a beautiful jalapeno burger that was done just right and a side of asparagus that was absolutely wonderful   Love this place.  A new favorite for me

k0SPic2WaWZ96jc0T2brMg.text: Love this location, the menu, pretty much everything there is here. I've been several times, always get a burger, and I'm never disappointed with it. Portions are perfect- I never leave hungry... maybe a little over-full because I don't want to waste any of the yummy food! The service isn't what I'd hope for in Scottsdale, always have a server that is new or too busy, but it's not a deal breaker for this place.

8cA2Q4Xqd7c_L-JVv7PyEw.text: Great spot to be with friend and family. Service was the best!  My water glass would not get half empty before they filled it.  The food was excellent!  Thank you Justin for a wonderful experience!

ciSO1ML5MDsLuXv55HFlUQ.text: Amazing service!! The half off steak and bottles of wine on Tuesday nights is incredible. I will be coming back for sure

FoqxW-5Zjs2Z4xpcRte1rQ.text: Great burgers.  Lousy steak. I have never had a filet that hurt my jaw to eat. There are plenty of places that do steak 10x better for less $.   I would give 5 stars for the burgers. Taking 1 back for the shoe leather.

oJarX0MEeW9wvXyBDzqqCQ.text: I decided to come here due to the favorable recommendations on yelp. Unfortunately it was not as life changing as others seemed to advertise. I got the classic burger, which to be fair was generous in size, was pretty good but not going to change your life. The creamed corn was pretty good but came out at lukewarm and I wanted it to piping hot. The salt and vinegar fries only had a very subtle vinegar taste like maybe the fries were made next to a vinegar bottle that forgot to tip into the fries. The inside decor is pretty good but the music is just a tad too loud so everyone is just kind of screaming at each other. It gives the feeling like you are in the club but somehow instead of my usual vodka sprite I had a big burger in one hand and a fries in the other. Overall good but not great.

slBNyhKqhro45oyPpl8qrA.text: Beer and a burger for $10, sign me up! located next to Olive & Ivy, this place offers premium steaks, very good service, and a decent happy hour. If you are very hungry or have a carnivorous friend to share with, try the enormous Tomhawk steak. I hear this place can have a pretty long wait on weekends so I'd probably stick to coming on weekday evenings.

0zmtEynnOAbVs7EQRHoiTQ.text: HandCuts service is excellent, Kirsten is a fantastic server with a bright personality and kind smile. I saw a video that included Kylee, their bartender creating an incredible Manhattan on Facebook, although I'm not a fan of whiskey she makes some of the best margaritas in town! Not the biggest fan of their entrees but their appetizers and salads kill it. My personal favorite is the steak tartare and salmon toast. The Kale Caesar and Steak Salad is a great choice for the health freaks. Salt and vinegar fries hit the spot.

VncYNkGRgx9G6yyGqBIuJg.text: We all really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was yummy.  Prices were fair.  The family loved the truffle mash potatoes.  We would recommend it for all.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B_wRXfpW92uTroccn4IjAA.text: Great cocktails, yummy fries, good burgers, bad service.  My burger would have been AH-amazing had it been medium rare like I ordered but there was no pink at all.  If the kitchen figures how to cook beef and the servers get it together this place would be perfect!  I'd still go back for the fries and a cocktail for sure.

zEP5m5WN2F4uTQ-mfOFdFw.text: This place...I wanted to like it more than I do. I gave it two tries before I gave up.  First time, I asked for no bun...so I only received a burger patty with the cheese. No sauce, lettuce, pickles...the things that normally go on the burger I ordered. I told the waitress, she brought all the goodies on a separate plate. I ordered medium, I received rare.  Second time, our appetizer took FOREVER & was basically a salad.  I thought I'll beat them at their own game & I'll order a gluten-free wrap (why won't they just serve GF buns!??) & order medium-well. I DID get all my goodies this time, but I got rare meat again.  I don't want to go again, try to order WELL & get rare again. So, I quit.   Bottom line, I make better burgers. I can make them with grass-fed beef for under $10 a piece, so I will. The convenience isn't worth it if you don't even get what you want.

bMccVf69cYemfJa8JZlFqQ.text: The wings that are billed as "hand cut, drizzled with herb garlic honey", are nothing but a salt lick. You can't taste anything except the overpowering salt - I love salt more than the average person but these were inedible and a waste of $12. The Carmel cake was almost as much of a disappointment.

HJhISMBxt_ztBv5m_8v-ZA.text: Super cute place! I loved the decor. The service was very refreshing and fast! Right away we were greeted by the host and hostess and they were friendly. Our server was great and the food was delicious! We split the western burger and Mac and cheese and we can't wait to go back!

oD6j3B_nHxoHbYTxul47Tg.text: I eat here at least twice a week.  Their steak, jalapeno burger, hot wings,  salmon appetizer, and ice cream  are my favorites ...nom nom nom

fMX5NL4eCa8BrJYVfYeLsw.text: I love when the vibe of a restaurant, the food, and the service all come together to form the perfect night out. We were able to get a reservation on the grand opening night and they did not disappoint. Every table was full, the DJ was playing, and the service was on point! We pretty much sampled the whole menu with our large group.. Salt and vinegar fries are AMAZING!!! The best start to our dinner. Followed by the creamy corn and Mac n cheese, both amazing as well. Steak was cooked to perfection and the cheeseburger (topped with bacon and onion rings) did NOT suck! Thank god for stretchy jeans because we finished the night off with an ice cream cookie sandwich.. Some of the best local ice cream, and the mint chocolate chip cookie is to die for! I will definitely be back very soon!

g4b_G_5R8G-ktE8Svi7DXA.text: Walked by this place yesterday and boy was I impressed. From the looks of it they really found the perfect balance between chophouse and upscale burger dinning I have already heard awesome things I can't wait to come in and try it out

hk5lNcaNqAWHJ7tPNIj3ow.text: I love everything about this place. Great burgers and THE BEST salt and vinegar fries with dill and ranch. The Blackberry mojito is amazing, and the butter cake is just ridiculous. The entire staff is super friendly and helpful. I will definitely be going back.

qoFMHEYO-py4BBkJ4hWdHg.text: We stopped in to hand cut for happy hour and had such a great experience. They have their signature cocktails (happy hour) for the same price that you would buy a well cocktail anywhere else in old town. We also got a bunch of the appetizers to split with our table. Everything came out super quickly and our server was amazing. I would highly recommend this place over and over again!

PosG-BRGwgxBIhuXML_hvw.text: I'm thrilled to have this great new restaurant in Old Town!  I had dinner with 2 friends last night.  First of all, I loved the eclectic decor--so much fun!  Second, our service was great.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  I had to send a drink back because I hadn't realized when I ordered it that it had bitters in it, which I hate.  I never do that, but I absolutely couldn't stomach it.  The server was very nice about it and even kept apologizing, even though it was my fault rather than hers.  Last, but definitely not least, the food was fantastic!!  We shared the carbonara and cauliflower apps.  The one complaint was that the servings were small for being "to share", but the flavors were great.  Then I had the classic burger--cooked to perfection, juicy, and a good bun.  And it was a perfect size, not of those giant burgers that you can't fit in your mouth.  My friends had 2 of the other burgers and loved them.  The fries were great too!  I will definitely be back!

2ewapqsPksQXqvL0zMOCkQ.text: Go straight to the bar and have Matt fix you some amazing cocktails, will be best decision you make .

viWc3juh8xBey3zKkZaN-Q.text: I'm a burger SNOB. This was in my top 20 burgers of all time. Atmosphere was great. Staff was friendly. Service a bit slow and ditzy but overall still a great experience.

zU3ZVpiEsCNqtHEL779ALA.text: This place gets it.  The best of the upscale burger bars by far.  The blue cheeses burger, medium rare, with salt and vinegar fries was phenomenal - only topped by the service.  I have been many times and the bartenders, all of them, are the best. Thanks for moving in a block away!!

y72_zbJufb_dEgypjtCjng.text: Saw Matt at the bar for lunch, great bartender and very knowledgeable. Burgers were great but the cocktails are the star of the show. Will return to this place often.

mqevLVUBb9k_VJBIkWT6uA.text: Great meal, cool atmosphere!  Loved the filet & added lobster claw w truffle. It was rich & flavorful. Smoked salmon toast with the pickled red onions was a huge portion so perfect to share. Highly recommend the Bugey-Cerdon bubbles! My new fave. Husband had the classic burger & he loved it. Awesome new place. Can't wait to go back & try more menu items.

h2iW6xuSwuEibJ09ShiGyQ.text: Had lunch here this weekend. Excellent burgers. The flavor was outstanding and the tempura zucchini fries a must. I had the wedge salad with chicken it also was very good . They used romain lettuce wedges . Wait staff was very attentive. I highly recommend this place!

xsEqTOdFcLr6k-RZO91J6g.text: We were told it would be a 25 minute wait, which became a 1 hour wait even with 3 parties ahead of us leaving since they didn't want to wait any longer. Then they were telling people it'd be a 45 minute wait for the food alone. We found out the owner told his staff to tell everyone coming through the door that it'd be a 25 minute wait while at the same time he was sitting with his family eating and not giving a care in the world. I came here with my brother and talked it up to be a great place but now I'm embarrassed. Basic customer service, courtesy, and math skills are NOT required to own or manage this place. I'll be sure to spread the word.

KLrRgM-TydKONgb6zrVE3Q.text: great burgers (spinach dip is terrible) and atmosphere but service sucks...SLOWEST service ever and they brought appetizer after burger. it's run so poorly. the key to their success will be their hiring decisions.

JSqC1z2D2jqKfSd1wGHy_Q.text: This place is awesome! The decor dragged us in, we were just walking by. The decor is very funky and chic all the details and decorations reminded me of a funky juicy couture store. If you get a cocktail try the bramble it was delicious and recommended to me by the waitress. We had an awesome waitress so friendly and attentive, I cannot remember her name. Me and my friend both had the kale salad and I added salmon which was delicious! I will defiantly be coming back

z7YiOILqPaz3v6k2PUhY0A.text: Great place. The interior is gorgeous and the food is amazing.

kYI2I3F8zwiXO9TIYmDO2g.text: Met friends here based on recommendation from PBS. If you have party larger than 4/5, may be a cozy seating setup. We had party of 6. Menu explained by very attentive server who explained the grass fed beef concept. Not knowledgeable about seafood entree. I know better than to ask for fish in a chop house. But I really wanted a nice piece of salmon. Wrong restaurant. Chicken sandwich for companion was great. Steak and venison dishes were well prepared. Side dishes were generally good, but cauliflower was overlooked and fries were a little salty. Odd that although I ordered salad as part of meal, it came with entree and the half dozen sides ordered by the table. Server did not ask whether I wanted salad early or with entree. Very odd. Dessert included the buttercake that the servers raved about. Obviously never had homemade cake before.  Very average dinner. Big on Arizona grown beef locally sourced, but that is all that you can say about the place or the food.

r9FNtA5poCU8A-Osi8ltNw.text: Our bartender Sam was the best bartender and server we've ever had. She was incredibly attentive and sweet even though it was busy and she was training new staff. All bartenders should be like her. I will be definitely coming back for the great drinks and service!! AMAZING!

dreyC2UZYuQlAEgIXmec1Q.text: Loud hipster DJ inside took away one star from a great dinner. Great food, reasonable prices for Scottsdale. Good looking bar menu with the exception of the beer list which was pretty boring.  Only two local beers, Sonora White Chocolate and San Tan Moon juice. They could really bump up the craft beer list quite easily.  Food was on the spicy side but that suited us just fine.

YBmIxzP6KfZVphTn5mMXKg.text: Visited for the first time. 4 of us.Had the fries and the wings as appraisers.  Fries were good. Wings had a very strong overwhelming taste.  Then we had burgers.  The mushroom burger was good.  The blue cheese burger and the chicken sandwich were average.  The California burger was good.  The service was good.

QmNJqlfAYaX8LM88pjWRWw.text: This review is long overdue! Matt took care of us for my birthday dinner a few weeks ago and it was fabulous! He hooked it up with shots and our server was also amazing and very attentive. I had been there before and chose to go there for my birthday because of the fun atmosphere and good food/drinks. Def a good spot in old town to start your night

BEhYiUL-B60QecTGcRgr-Q.text: The decor and ambiance of this place is beautiful. Eclectic and trendy. Super stoked to be able to enjoy AZ grass fed beef at another place in the Phx area however the food was subpar. Out of 5 of us only 2 of us got the burger temperatures we ordered. Mine was inedible, but my kale salad was delicious. The salt and vinegar fries were yummy especially the dill aioli that accompanied them. The hand cut baked potato wasn't fully cooked and the Brussel sprouts and sweet potato side was full of sugar and also inedible. The glass of wine is listed as 6oz but the actually serving that was poured was no where near that. Service was ok- probably the better part of our experience however it didn't blow me away. Honestly we were all really excited to try this place out, but it's looking like it's another trendy joint that is focused solely on aesthetics and not that actual product it's serving. I hope it gets better, but won't be trying it out again anytime soon.

vFrHWLqGUN1yX3fp1OnYDg.text: Really unique cocktails with hand made ice cubes and fresh fruits. Loved the bar area and bartenders Kylie and Carmelo were so cool. They'll make you anything you want. Great eclectic decor. Good music playing too. We will be back.

ie0jlfiqxv1F583cIbCz7w.text: Hand * Cut Burgers and Chophouse is amazing! It's an cool modern twist to your favorite burgers and steak house. All in one salads, burgers and steak, all very yum I might add! They come the wonderful staff that created el hefe, whiskey row, and farm and craft in old town Scottsdale. I went to check it out on the week day, not a lot of people, middle of the day, staff was very friendly and attentive! When you walk in it's like your in a lounge but a cool lounge with vintage and colorful decor! I love it, it makes it what it is, which is cool, hip and can be enjoyed for all ages. Wide selection for their full bar, they even have a cool ice cream parlor for desserts. Lots of seating for inside, bar and even cool prop seating to the the Scottsdale fashion square mall, and people watching. Let's talk about the eats, I ordered the Jalapeno Ranch burger really superb, loved how it was spicy but not spicy where I needed water, it was a tasty spice! Which I really loved and I think they mastered. Everything is a la carte but I don't think you'll have a sad wallet After your meal. Everything is fairly affordable and you'll walk out the place a happy and satisfied customer. I also shared the sweet potato and Brussels sprouts, ugh delicious I love sweet potatoes and BS tho! Definitely wanna go for happy hour, it looks like they have such a wide and cool cocktail menu! Oh btw everything is made in house, and local produce way to go! Well Phoenix come through and eat a burger, stay hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeño Ranch Burger.

e5rw7i1Nmn9rKHM71mViPw.text: Came here for reverse happy hour. Got a draft beer, which was supposed to be $3 a beer, according to their Instagram post and menu. Turned out to be coors only and a "typo" according to the manager. They didn't adjust the bill for their typo.

hZBmmst4nRQB5Ih9bxkBiw.text: Let's start by saying that I wanted to love this place so much. I had such high hopes. We waited 1 hour for a table on a Friday evening around 7:30pm. We shopped around and came back around 8:30pm. After sitting down and ordering, we waited 40 more minutes for our meal (just basic burgers and fries). Finally, around 9pm, we got our food and started eating, and it was quite possibly the worst burger I've ever had. I ordered it medium well and it was rare. The burger was rock hard on the outside, and the meat was super stringy and overcooked (yet raw throughout the entire inside). I ordered the "Californian" burger that was supposed to come with avocado and sweet potato shoestrings, and they forgot all of my toppings. I asked the waiter for my toppings and he brought me a BROWN avocado slice and 1 tablespoon of sweet potato crumbs (no joke). I took 1 bite of my burger, doused in ketchup, and just couldn't even stomach the rest. The waitstaff was nice, but I just could not see myself paying $15 for a burger that literally way worse than I could ever get at a fast food restaurant.  Overall, we wont be back. Again, I'm so bummed that this place wasn't a win. I'm always looking for a new spot to grab a burger on the weekend, but this place definitely was not it. :(  Final heads up: The music is SUPER loud. There is a live DJ which is pretty cool, but the music wasn't conducive to a restaurant setting. I love a good scene, but I couldn't even talk to my boyfriend without shouting.

zICh7nP-EZp5ryQ2yLE_IA.text: Western burger, plain fries, Mac n Cheese, ice cream sandwich... Delicious. Definitely will come back.

KlO-dbkbkO_fuEDW7VAqDw.text: I was excited to try Hand Cut after reading the great reviews...especially after being so new! We stopped in for lunch today and loved it.  The vibe is quite cool...great furniture, open concept and bright colors.  Service was good - pretty efficient and friendly.  The food was delicious - I thoroughly enjoyed my mushroom and cheddar burger and we shared the baked potato.  Everyone at the table was pleased...the regular burger and the chicken sandwich too!

BwmhQq7-dx8AEB4_QyKT_A.text: They were crazy busy so service was a little suspect, they more than made up for it though as things calmed down. Food was amazing, going back for sure. Love me a gourmet burger!

gXjBqbN4EkGxgaZff5OADg.text: The food here is amazing!  The sides are probably my favorite... the Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes, the creamed corn, the macaroni... amazing! This is a must go to spot!  Not to mention the old fashion I had was delicious as well.

OXh9qo1dfbi5c-DmWpUbDA.text: I was super impressed.  In every way.   Food was really good.  You can tell they have a great chef.  The sauces and tastes were exceptional.   The layout was comfortable.   We will come back for sure

-bfXd06r4neOwe0-kOd39A.text: My husband and I took our two young teenagers and we left full and happy!!! The service was great and the food was top-notch!! Kale salad, western bacon, baked potato with short rib, and the crispy chicken sandwich...all amazing!!! Not to mention the fries and onion rings!! Will definitely be coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wDhKqoCVhvBJMUIakujFYw.text: I work on the Waterfront and I've been meaning to try this place since it opened. I called about 4 times to put in an order for pick up and no one answered the phone. I only have so long for my lunch breaks so calling food in early is a must. Haven't even tried the food yet, but unless they get better at answering phones I definitely won't be going any time soon.

5sXPNlw73C0X3DtYdDljoQ.text: Couple more visits...disappointing food. Nice vibe and wish them the best. But expected more from the burger and sides.

L_-tdTzxvTsZXAFkzGib0A.text: My friend Jeremy took us to dinner last night because I flew into town to visit him and some friends. The staff seems untrained and if i have to keep asking for things 5+ times I'm not sure what they're doing. I would understand if it was a busy night, but it was only half full. Even when getting our checks, it took about 25 min......  Food was alright, a bit cold, drinks were sub par.

-ng5kJhqNfCLRwN_Cu-mKg.text: This place is more like a bar that serves food.  Music is really loud and the burgers are ok.  If you want a great burger goto in and out.  It's cheaper and way better.

1cuTL2jQwpTp_ghZnMuTCg.text: While this is definitely a nice place, the Food leaves as lot to be desired..very Overpriced for value received...high Price for average wine...but a very friendly  Staff

6uAPWMb8glQdkl_lqxeOuA.text: Go on a Tuesday! Get there early and apps are half price, wine by the glass is $5. The smoked salmon appetizer is incredible and consists of 4 pieces of toasted ciabbata topped with a thin smear of cream cheese, the salmon, arugula, and pickled red onion. Outstanding. On to the steaks (and other "hand cuts" )that are half price on Tuesdays. The fillet is excellent, Arizona grass-fed beef. The steaks were perfectly cooked. The place is super casual, small, and service is very friendly and efficient.

pGtF0kok4R6erd2RJ1gZzA.text: Lobster burger is fantastic! Our server Miranda was absolutely amazing went above and beyond to help celebrate my friends birthday! Defiantly will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing sundae for dessert

Cf5OfdTY5939G6JTX9C-BQ.text: Hand Cut just opened a few blocks from my office and my wife and I went for dinner. The restaurant is in a great location in the Southbridge/Fashion Square part of Old Town. A high rent part of Old Town, but with surprisingly reasonable prices. Great date night location. We had the house cab, a chopped salad with goat cheese, wings, and burgers. Great experience. We will definitely be back.

P4rLfE7zzS9BQWgE50jUOA.text: This is a great spot!  I have been there a couple times now once on a super busy Saturday and once on a calm Tuesday. Both times food and service was great.  If you want a great steak skip the super high priced steakhouses in the area, they have amazing cuts, they don't over season and cook to perfection. Sides are great, burgers are great and they have a good happy hour.  This is rapidly moving to the top of our favorite restaurants in old town. Weekends it's got a fun and loud atmosphere and weekdays it's a great atmosphere and a bit more laid back. I would recommend this place and they do a great job with special occasions and making it special.

PayTWugQ41qaJ3ShgdgRkQ.text: Amazing service by Priscilla. The salt vinegar fries are extremely good, also had the Western Burger, it was juicy and well seasoned. The onion ring and thick cut black pepper bacon blends great with the burger and the chipotle bbq sauce.

QzLzmHvONL1UPVAKckKcdw.text: The hand cut burger is good, but their scallops is the best.

SbSHkXJSdOlS9V1Zu8JOEQ.text: (Lyrics - Sheryl Crow - The First Cut Is The Deepest)  I would have given you all of my stars But there's something that's torn me apart And it's singing songs when I Yelp But if you want I'll try to love you again Chophouse, I'll try to love again, but you know....  At Handcut ... Burger & Chophouse Burgers you know At Handcut ... Burger & Chophouse And when it comes to onion rings, it's crisp When it comes to french fries, it's dilled  I stopped by here for a Sunday Brunch with my family.  They were very accommodating and helpful with the seating and the service was very good.  The place is open like a farm to table atmosphere with some jamming music.  Everyone seemed so hip....man I'm old!  I wanted to try their burgers so bad, but I didn't feel like eating a full one by myself and didn't want to take any home.  So I went with the Hanger Steak instead.  My family and I all shared their Salt & Vinegar Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Onion Rings, and Macaroni and Cheese.  Overall, I really enjoyed their creativity with the fries which also came along with dill and dill ranch dip.  My favorite bite was probably the onion rings which was extra crisp with a hard crunchy breading which helped contain the warm bite every time!  I didn't care much for the sweet potato fries since...it is what it is and the mac and cheese was supposed to come with lobster, but didn't get much of that at all; again love the creativity here!  My hanger steak was okay.  I wanted it medium rare, but only the middle cut was at the right temperature while the two tips were well done.  It came along with a creamy butter atop, but that only covered the middle section of my steak;  I was totally craving for that butter haha!  It really helped make the steak pop for me, but there only morsels of it!    In the end, I rather enjoyed my visit to this place, but I need to shoot for what I want next time I guess.  I heard their burgers were bomb so until next time! - Enjoy!

Gk9coyL7Kfp_mb2TN2K2lQ.text: ORIGINAL REVIEW: I have very mixed feelings about Hand Cut. It is right around the corner from my house so I love the convenience. The food is amazing, great steaks and phenomenal veal. My only trouble with Hand Cut is that the service I get there is pretty inconsistent. Sometimes they are sharp and quick and sometimes I'll get a server who doesn't know what a "neat" drink is and forget my table exists. Still haven't decided if this place is for me, let's see if they can pull it together and tighten up a bit!  UPDATE: Kevin has reached out to me and because of their amazing marketing and customer service, I'm confident that they will be taking care of me in the future and genuinely care about improving. (Hence the adjustment of my review). I will be eating here much more as time continues!

42sRrMkHzjLy_VAkngBAjA.text: First time stopping in and had the best experience. Greeted by our amazing server Nate, his smile lit up the room and made us feel so welcome!  The food was awesome! We'll definitely be coming back soon!

Q-CvAadpO__VVNP1q08iCA.text: Our server Priscilla was excellent, very attentive, very apologetic for not having the sandwiches we wanted... at 12:30 on Friday the short rib dip was unavailable (baking for another hour), so two of our party had to settle for something else.   Crispy chicken was very good, chicken melt was ok.  Both had more bread than chicken though.  Burger was ok.  Sweet potato fries were good, aioli was great.  Salt & vinegar fries are AMAZING.   Probably won't go back but might just for fries!  Thought it was a bit pricey since sides are a la carte.

RSGCQ-5LFM0XKECOSXqKRQ.text: Cool setting. The smoke trout was amazing.  Venison chops really good.  A return visit is in order.  Ooh, had to reduce ratings from 4 to 2 starts.  Follow up visit not nearly as good as first two.   Smoked trout was replaced by smoked salmon.  Went from something tastey and unique to something ordinary and bland. Scallops with apple bacon compote had muddy flavors that was unremarkable .  Finally my desert plating was a paper cup with a plastic spoon. The bright spot was server, Sofia.  I'll give one more chance to see how it goes during the season.

vWGktOTjFUdFuGvoaICGjg.text: LOVE this place. Wen't for my birthday with a large group and they were SO accommodating. Food is great, drinks are great, service is great!

WcDRVAHG5Z-hFjC6-huCNw.text: Casual steakhouse/burger place in Scottsdale.  Shorts and T-shirt's and we fit right in. Had the Jalapeno Burger, spicy and good.  Ranch Onion rings had a little too much ranch seasoning for me.   The onion rings were great though when run through the sauce drippings from the burger.  Had some of my wife's Mac and cheese, good stuff.  Topped it off with warm butter cake and ice cream.  Will be back.

cm7zjrF6eqt3khC1LZgtCw.text: I'm not sure where to start.     When we booked our reservation on Open Table, it showed the option of indoor or outdoor seating.    What it didn't say ANYWHERE was that there are only 2 tables for 4 outside and 1 table for 2.   One of the tables for 4, is pretty much on the sidewalk.    Thankfully we didn't have to sit at that one.      Our waiter came over, brought us waters and took our drink order.    When he brought our drinks back we put in our order.   We didn't order any appetizers and he never even suggested any.     45 min later, we still didn't have our burgers or sides.    The manager only wanted to give us another round of drinks but drinking strong drinks on a very empty stomach......not a great idea.     She then brought out or sides about 3 or 4 min before our burgers.     The excuse - we had a lot of large parties tonight.    I understand things like that happen and you get backed up.   It would have been nice to be told that when we ordered....or even 30 min later.    After dinner we weren't even offered a dessert menu.    I did ask for one but the waiter came back with our check instead.    They comped our burgers and charged us for the drinks and sides which was the appropriate thing to do.    However, it would have been nice to see the dessert menu and not "get kicked out" as we felt that is what was happening.         As for the food, the onion rings were fabulous and so were the snap peas.   I ordered my burger medium and it was more  medium - well to well done.    Aside from all that, the inside of the restaurant looked lovely.    There were big tvs for sports as well as a DJ.    The atmosphere was nice.     For the that I give it 1 star and for the sides another star.

wYLAZF53QhHZgGYies9ywA.text: Well, visually it is pleasing. fun colors and atmosphere. I ordered the wings and the tempura zucchini. I was actually really excited to eat here as it was a recommendation from a local and friend. Well, I think I pissed off the server because she was very tiny and I called her short. Like a wow you're really tiny way, as in I was surprised about her height and once we got got our food. We never saw her again. So maybe she is a heightest.   The wings were interesting. Flavorful but not to my taste. The atmosphere is also loud so don't try to have. Conversation. The tempura zucchini was average and lacked flavor. Wife got a burger. Average. Go to rehab burger therapy. Tastes better and is cheaper.

hqixPJrw78y37AtMS2GP6Q.text: This place has got it made. The atmosphere is great and has a very young club like vibe. The food was  very good, especially the short rib dip. Downsides would be slow service. As much as I would expect them to be better staffed for a Friday night, the place was packed so it's understandable. The other down would be drink prices. I get that it's Scottsdale, but 13 dollars for a vodka Red Bull is a little high.

Ie9uc2XlBp5rS6zDLAEANg.text: Happy hour food portions and taste where on spot but beer happy hour selection sucks "Coors & Coors lite" really that's the only choice? Please rethink this because you can't say beer happy hour with one beer it's like saying happy hour cocktails and having one choice of cocktail. I will be coming back sometime soon and hope to see more beers on happy hour.

aJJPnY0JW5o7Lx6UfeE85g.text: Amazing! This is probably my new favorite burger place in Scottsdale! The food was just to die for! The salt and vinegar fried are seasoned so well and just different enough to make them a novelty, our burgers were juicy, and flavors all around delicious! Highly recommend this restaurant!

1Nib_WLaYxMdFjiY-2INfA.text: The food IS good. (Avoid the snap peas. They taste only like the soy sauce they are bathed in).  Just don't choose Hand Cut for a business lunch. The music is too loud for serious conversations. You may as well be negotiating in a disco.  What's worse? They won't turn the volume down when you ask -- even if there's only three other occupied tables in the whole place.

TqKulJjAhpTBWboA3RmAeg.text: Met up with some friends for Friday night dinner and this place really met my expectations. It was a casual fancy vibe and they had a dj playing good music! Which went good with the drinks we were having ;) some waitresses were handing out samples of crown royale Carmel apple. I got the blueberry mojito , it looked cute but taste wise was a 7 , my friend let me try his drink:  strawberry crush with banana foam and it was so yummy! I'll be getting that next time. I got the 8oz filet with butter garlic mushrooms and it was good and the sides are great to share with people. We all shared the asparagus, truffle mash potatoes and the Mac and cheese and it was all delicious. Made my stomach and soul happy

GcwjbwoZMgz4KyGFzt8yuQ.text: The best burger in America! I had the classic burger  and it tasted like a much better version of a Big Mac. A fancy and tasty version of a Big Mac. So so so good. I could get back to Arizona only for this burger. Loved it!

55YJQ2c2yzi4zM0k7H-RSw.text: Overpriced. Over cooked. Limited selection of food, beer, and wine.   Took a long time to get our drinks initially. Everyone at my tables had their burgers or steaks over cooked by at least two levels. I would not suggest this place in the future.

HWlDp-bNk1Co5MuuKP5XoQ.text: I stopped in for lunch recently and am blown away that I didn't realize this place even existed until now. They have a lunch special, $10 for a burger, fries, and a drink and it was great. As I walked in the hostess greeted me and asked where I would like to sit. Since I was by myself I sat at the bar and just looked around. I was very impressed by the decor and the setup. The place is friendly with a good combination of hightops, booths, tables, and bar seats. It took me a minute to realize that not only does it have an open kitchen style where you can see the food being prepared, there is actually a glass wall next to the South row of booths where you can see the meat being prepared and cut... i.e. Hand Cut!  The bartender was very friendly and answered my questions about the items on the menu. I went with a bacon cheeseburger along with sweet potato fries and a soda. The wait for food was not long and when I got it, it was excellently cooked and delicious.  I will definitely be returning and highly recommend it if you're in the area and looking for a good burger. In fact I'd say it's better than Shake Shack and you get a better atmosphere at a much more reasonable price. Check it out!

ShzP43mds0G0KSnqswtZeg.text: Been here multiple times and have had a wide array of items, from appetizers, burgers, desserts, drinks - I've never received anything that was short of extraordinary.  The vibe is great with modern decor and an open feeling that is great for a casual lunch or a fun evening out with a group. Parking is convenient via the underground garage that exits right next door.  I have and will continue to go out of my way to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tomahawk steak!

5o8oOCnRRfTxVQ1ojtDDAw.text: "I don't like it if it don't gleam, gleam and to hell with the price cuz the money ain't a thang". Classic hip-hop as I walk in and bass I can feel in my bones?  My my Hand Cut, aren't we off to a good start!   We were greeted by an enthusiastic server who's name started with a K. K. explained that all beef is grass fed and grass finished (no antibiotics or hormones) and they try to source everything at the local level. She knew the menu and was able to give suggestions with confidence.  Fantastic service!  We went with the following:  Salt & Vinegar Fries: they taste exactly how they sound, are garnished with fresh dill (love that), and served with a small side of house ranch...I could have used more ranch.  Macaroni Carbonara: the sunny side up egg on top makes this dish!    California Burger: How cute was this lil burg!  The portions are pretty small but at least there was some good flavor.  Highlights were the sprouts and pickled onions.  Mushroom Burger: this was the superior burger!!!  Add the egg.  It is totally worth it because Hand Cut's fried egg game is tight!  The mushrooms are roasted then drizzled with balsamic vinegar.  The arugula and roasted garlic mayo didn't hurt!  Last we were taken on a treat journey!  Chocolate Chip cookie with Salted Carmel Ice Cream: I am not sure how they pulled off intense salt flavor in their Salted Camel ice cream with out being offensively salty.  The salt flavor came first and was followed by sweet creaminess.  I would say it's some of the best salted caramel ice cream I have had.  The cookie was great too.  It was crunchy enough that it didn't fall apart but soft enough to stab with a spoon.  Overall, it was a great and entertaining meal!

FAR-ZNA4wbsKFTSfQmONYw.text: I have a few complaints about this restaurant, enough to make me not go there.   My biggest complaint about this restaurant is the seating. There is a complete lack of regard or consideration for anyone who is in a wheelchair. The majority of the seating is either high tables or booths that are right by the bar. How is someone in a wheelchair supposed to comfortably be seated at a booth with people sitting at the bar directly behind them moving their chairs? Wheelchair-accessible seating is not designated to booths in the first place; it should be a normal low table. The lower tables are outside, what a complete lack of regard for ALL customers. (not to mention I think there are only 2-3 regular tables outside). The majority of the seating should be low, with some high tables. I will not support a business that doesn't provide adequate seating to all customers.   Second, the waitresses are annoying. When I came here with my mom and my husband, the waitress kept calling my husband "sweetie, honey" etc. Sorry, but if I wanted to hear a waitress talk that way I would go to Hooters. It made him uncomfortable and it was completely uncalled for.  Third, the first and ONLY time I got a drink from the bar it came with a beautiful lip mark already on it. It was apparent that someone obviously took a sip out of it before bringing it to my table. There are a lot better places out there, skip this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hand Cut Burgers & Chophouse - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I took this photo as my drink arrived. The cocktail had a lip mark on it when I received it. It sure wasn&#39;t mine.

t-DeocGQ4xtKXkRiYiJL9g.text: This is bullshit, I wish I could give 6 stars. My server Priscilla, was the most beautiful, genuine, and respectful lady I have ever had the advantage of having served me. Not only did she have amazing service, but the food was absolutely amazing, 10/10.

i12IJhYyRAih-9AAelb0aA.text: This is a very cool place to grab a burger, or for that matter, a serving of any type of red meat.  While they do have salads, the menu leans towards burgers, chops and steaks.  My visit here over the weekend was very fun.  The decor and music is upscale, hip and trendy.  Kind of like a steakhouse meets a nightclub or lounge.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed the chopped salad, crispy baked chicken wings and the hand cut classic burger.  All were very good but I definietly want to come back and try their steaks.  The bartenders were very friendly and made great cocktails.  My Manhattan and my friend's Sazerac were excellent.

XueIJ34eNLKPmgjONEKCpA.text: This place is so perfect.  Great scene, delicious food on a non-overcomplicated menu.  Every drink I've ever ordered here has been perfect.  Very friendly staff too!!

LXeToFI4xF6kcQ4JMYLyDQ.text: Earlier reservation yet ran out of brussel sprouts, odd!  From the moment we entered we were turned off at the noise level for being so early in the evening and how very young the staff appeared, however, loved the decor and open concept!  We were excited to try it but that excitement was grossly postponed as we waited....and waited.....and yes, waited for service!  When we finally did have a server come to our table and take drink orders, i think they were still distilling the alcohol; then the same once we finally got the servers attention to take our food order.  By this time we had been there almost an hour!!! On a positive note the burgers were fabulous; one of the best any of us had tasted.  For just a few minutes we were able to forget the very loud music and horrific service but that didn't last as we couldn't get her attention to get our bill.  We may go back for the burger and give it another try but during the day.  Maybe there's an adult monitoring the servers and maybe the music will be a more conducive level for day hours.  I'll have to think about this one......

pYScJadZdemy7X2hf6W6ng.text: Food was great, bartender was nice. Cramped quarters between the bar seats and the booths behind but the hostess was just parading around with an Ipad and it kept jabbing me in the back as Im sitting there eating at the bar and not once did she say excuse me, or sorry or anything. Just kept hitting me in the back with this ipad, several times, she clearly had no control over as she squeezed by people walking through the aisle. Excellent food but that chick was terrible.

5iC84PwgEXDkr4MvxVdZ3w.text: My friends and I decided to try this place out on Friday. It has the vibe of going out without really going out. They have awesome music, the atmosphere is really trendy and fun, and it has a nice modern feel to it. Their menu is great, and has some vegetarian options. They have a happy hour, too. The food was so delicious. We got a variety of sides to split. The only thing that took away from it was the slower service. It was Friday and busy, but we had to ask our waitress multiple times to get our water.

QhhwaClBp9823lkziP1cug.text: Had a friend recommend this place and it was awesome. The staff and bartenders were friendly and informative as it was our first time. (Sorry, I forget their names). Wonderful cocktails while we watched the Cav"s game.   Started with the salt and vinegar fries which were awesome. Moved onto grass fed Western burger which did not disappoint. Everything was hot and fresh. I also ordered the creamed corn which was probably my favorite item! It's rare places even offer creamed corn but absolutely worth it.    Lastly, Adam, one of the managers brought us over a peach cobbler and ice cream dessert that complemented our dinner perfectly. Adam spent extra time with our group to make sure our first time was a memorable one. I think I have found one of my new favorite places.  Big shout out to the staff and management.

RsdGfIE7bxVkVFKaeBzZGw.text: Went for lunch. They have a great lunch special burger,fries, and drink for $12. Burger was cooked perfectly, and tasted good. The k ion rings were outstanding with the powder ranch sprinkled on top. Service was good and the atmosphere is trendy. Will return.

R6Qb6LqRojEOfxsG-b7KrA.text: Had a really great lunch experience this afternoon. Arrived around 1130 am and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't too busy. Our hostess and waitress, Naomi, was very friendly and accommodated seating the stroller we had with us. We had a couple burgers that's were delish, a side salad and the salt and vinegar fries. The side salad could have had some more cucumbers or other veggies, but was still good. Also, I needed to eat dairy free and Naomi asked the kitchen to ensure everything was ok for me to eat. Great ambiance and service!

rmasW24bPoxFzLCCcjL3PA.text: They are by far one of the best places for a great burger in Scottsdale!  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was so fun and current.  Their side dishes are delicious. Super trendy. Loved it!!!

61I-6lbkzuPrN6_Tm1glrw.text: I discovered Hand Cut from a fellow Wild Dining MeetUp member, who told me he was coming here to eat on upcoming Tues for half price off 'the Cuts".  When I looked at the menu, I came on the same night in Aug, and saw him there.  He invited me to join him at his table.  Sara the Eurasian girl with long honey-colored hair, was our server.   She was so cute, adorable vivacious personality, and pretty, and came back to check on us at least 5 times!  We both ordered the venison chops, 2 for $11.  They were quite rare on the inside, but I like my red meat very red on inside.  The chops were so delicious.  We shared 2 half orders of onion rings $3, but the second order came out almost burnt and very very salty, like cook dumped the salt box in the coating.  By the time we had a couple of pieces there was really nothing to send back, so we didn't.    I give the service and venison chops 5 stars for my first visit!.  I was so impressed that I posted with only day's notice, another Tues 1/2 off Cuts on my Wild Dining MeetUp for my 2nd time on Sept 26, 2017.  Four people ordered venison chops, I ordered the 8 oz flat iron steak (very mediocre wouldn't order it again.  I could get a much better deal and taste at Golden Corral).    My receipt says Taylor was our server, a very tall thin girl with dark hair wadded up in two buns on each side of her head.  The Organizer of our Wild Dining MeetUp ordered her chops "medium", but it came as the rest of ours, bloody rare and definitely NOT "medium".  She sent it back, changed her order to the safer filet mignon.   I would have asked them to cook the chops longer, cos I hate waste and so sad to see the venison chops thrown in the trash (they have open kitchen you can see them prepare the food).  I do not know why the server who takes the orders does not also bring the food, cos other guys brought the food, and didn't know who ordered what.  They just put the food down in front of the wrong people, and we remarked they didn't even ask us "who ordered the onion rings" so they could plop down in front of the right person.  So our orders got all mixed up, and they left it up to "us" to make the corrections.  And of course, when the bills came, they put the wrong food orders on the wrong people's bills.  And someone had to take back the checks to get them corrected.    They seemed to have a designated person just to fill people's water glasses, so that was OK, but I do not recall that our server ever came back like Sara did (and 5 times) my first visit , to check on us.  I only saw Taylor when she took our orders.  In the end, we all talked about how poor the service was, especially just bringing the food and putting the wrong items in front of the wrong people without asking.  Myself, and the MeetUp organizer talked to Manager Brandon about being so unhappy with the service.  He appreciated our feedback and said they will do better next time.  1 or two stars for this second visit.  OK, third visit is Tues Oct 24, 2017, when I repost the same MeetUp as above to Wild Dining.  We sit at the same table for 8 in the back, and about 9 people on the waiting list occupy two nearby booths.  GM Brandon is no longer working there, already, so I told Kiley, Acting GM and bartender, about our poor service the previous time.  Kiley comped our table of 8, several free appetizers, and deliberately assigned my favorite Sara to be our server.  Sara did a GREAT job, and both Kiley and Sarah came back to ask us if everything was OK, several times.  Almost everyone ordered ribeye, and it was all perfectly grilled.  So delicious.  We all loved the food, and said we will be back again and again, but no one said they wanted to come back and pay full price on another night.  We will come back on Tues nights for half price cuts.  I give my first and third visits 5 stars for food and service, but 1-2 stars for the second time.  So overall 4 stars.

GH4BGaEgc39DJh-5e-Pd1Q.text: This place is so fire. I have gone twice and both times I got the Classic Burger and the salt and vinegar fries. The burger is sooo good. Definitely one of the best I've had. The buns they use are super fresh and they add a lot of cheese so it's especially melty and delicious. The sauce they put on the burger is to die for. Overall the burger is simple but because their ingredients are so high quality it makes the perfect burger that is amazingly juicy. I also love the dill sauce that comes with the fries!

PeEhZb5aJlGI_Uqbzquo8w.text: Happy hour food portions are great however the only beer we could get was Coors Light - not a large beer happy hour selection.

DO7g9ku7xboV1VluwZB3kQ.text: This was my girlfriend and I first time coming here to eat. This place was impressive in some areas but lacked in others. Started off great walked in and was seated right away. They had an actual DJ playing music while we ate. He had a great variety of songs. They were also playing the ASU football game and the DBacks game on the tv so I was happy with that. The first issue came when we didn't get acknowledged at the table for about 15 to 20 minutes. We didn't even have any water or anything while waiting for a waitress to come over. Once we order the food came in a timely manner. They forgot the bacon on my burger but the guy who brought out our food immediately got some bacon and gave it to me so that's fine. My girlfriend had the salmon and mashed potatoes and both were very good. My burger was cooked perfectly and was very good. The fries, on the other hand, were not good at all. They were overcooked. Like they made them previous and then dropped them in the grease again to give to me. My girlfriend also had the blackberry mojito and that was amazing as well. Overall, though this place is on the pricey side it was a decent experience.

AfD2Icr9XCgO21BTr-S3Pg.text: I went here on a Wednesday night, and it wasn't too busy. I got the veggie burger, which was really good! The sweet potato fries were the best fries I've had in a while! Our server was a little slow, but we were checked on multiple times by other staff members, so they might have a shared table system for the servers (idk). Overall really good meal and environment! I've already recommended to a coworker ;)

jGssqJmfzaZo-I1ZCqVoQw.text: I am so upset I don't remember our waitresses name .. she was AMAZING !! The service, the atmosphere, and the food deserve 5 stars!!  Loved everything about this place. Happy to have stumbled upon this place after shopping.

d81ky-fbf0VtEqRtFtjG7w.text: Fast service at the bar. We had the western and regular burger, salt and vinegar fries, and creamed corn. Everything was delicious. The creamed corn was amazing.

OjSWEo3-P02pEO8LSFqwXg.text: We LOVED everything about this place! From beginning to end, and even the day after! The entrance is beautiful, the service is attentive, the food is hot and delicious!! We will be back, I have already told 3 friends!!
